loans.name: San Antonio De San Roque Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “San Antonio de San Roque” iniciará su  primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, en el Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes, ocho mujeres y un varón.  Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados: venta y elaboración de pan, venta de chocolates y dulces, tienda de barrio, elaboración de  mantas, inicio de negocio, confección de chamarras, macramé de mantas, y tejidos, hilado de lana de vicuña y tejido a crochet, macramé de mantas.

 En el caso de la presidenta, señora Damiana está casada, es madre de tres hijos dos mujeres y un varón, indica que  cuenta con el negocio de tejido y venta de aguayos (el aguayo es un tejido en forma cuadrada de aproximadamente un metro por lado, son utilizados para cargar a los bebés a la espalda u otros.).  Ella aprendió este oficio de su madre hace más de veinte años atrás. La señora Damiana indica que los aguayos que ella elabora son muy apreciados por que están hechos de lana natural, son resistentes, mantienen el calor de lo que estuvieran  envolviendo, podría ser un bebé.
La elaboración de los aguayos se efectúa en el domicilio y generalmente son elaborados a pedido.  El dinero que la señora Damiana está solicitando le servirá para comprar lana.
texts.en:
The “San Antonio de San Roque” community bank is beginning its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer in the Panamericana regional office.  The group has nine members, eight women and one man.  The businesses which its members run are varied: making and selling bread, selling chocolates and pastries, neighborhood store, making blankets, starting a new business, making jackets, blanket macramé, knitting, spinning vicuña wool and crocheting.

In the case of the group president Damiana, she is married and has three grown-up children, two girls and a boy.  She tells us that she has a knitting business where she sells 'aguayos' (an 'aguayo' is a square-shaped knitted cloth which is approximately one meter long on each side.  It is used to carry babies or other things on your back).  She learned this trade from her mother more than twenty years ago.  Damiana tells us that the 'aguayos' which she makes are very much admired because they are made from natural wool, they are hard-wearing, they keep in the heat of whatever they are wrapped around, perhaps a baby.  She makes her 'aguayos' in her home and they are generally made to order.  The money which Damiana is requesting will be used to buy wool.

loans.use: To buy wool

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA D. LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba  y departamento D. Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Florencia; tiene 43 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. verduras, ella venD. tomates, lechugas, zanahorias, pepinos y cebollas en el mercado D. Urubamba y también tiene una pequeña chacra donD. cultiva las verduras, la socia quiere ampliar su negocio.  La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras al por mayor.


La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Florencia belongs to the “Reyna D. Los Angeles” (Queen of Angels) Community Bank.  The bank is in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Forencia, age 43, is married and has four children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling vegetables.  She sells tomatoes, lettuce, carrots, cucumbers, and onions at the Urubamba fair.  She also has a small farm where she grows the vegetables.

She wants to expand her business.  She is requesting the loan to buy vegetables wholesale.

She is grateful for the requested loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA D. LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba  y departamento D. Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Dominga; tiene 57 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. verduras, ella venD. todo tipo D. verduras como tomates, zanahorias, lechugas y cebollas, ella trabaja desD. las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, ella tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado D. Urubamba, la socia quiere mejorar su negocio.  La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras al por mayor.


La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Dominga belongs to the “Reyna D. Los Angeles” (Queen of Angels) Community Bank.  The bank is in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Dominga is a 57 year old widow, and she has six children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling vegetables.  She sells all types of vegetables like tomatoes, lettuce, carrots, and onions.  She works from six in the morning until five in the afternoon.  She has a small stand at the Urubamba market.  

She wants to improve her business.  She is requesting the loan to buy vegetables wholesale.

She is grateful for the requested loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Victoria; tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de gallinas, ella compra los pollitos pequeños y luego los engorda y los vende en los diferentes ferias que se realizan en la ciudad de Urubamba, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar gallinas al por mayor.


La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Victoria belongs to the “Reyna de Los Angeles” (Queen of Angels) Community Bank.  The bank is in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Victoria, age 48, is married and has six children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of raising chickens.  She buys the small chicks and then fattens them.  She sells them at the different fairs in the city of Urubamba.  

She wants to expand her business.  She is requesting the loan to buy chickens wholesale.

She is grateful for the requested loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy chickens wholesale

loans.name: Yaquelin

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Yaquelin; tiene 27 años de edad, y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y aceite, el socio atiende desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 11:00 p.m, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para la tienda de abarrotes.


La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This partner is a member of the Reyna de los Angeles community bank. The bank is in the Urubamba district in the Urubamba province, department of Cusco. The partner is 27 year old Yaquelin, who is single and has one child. 

This partner alternates her domestic activities with her small general store, where she sells goods such as rice, sugar, and oil. She is open from 5:00 am to 11:00 pm and wants to expand the business. 

She is requesting the loan to buy stock for her store. She is thankful for the loan and is committed to making payments as scheduled.

loans.use: The partner requests the loan to buy merchandise for her small general store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy household property

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida is 30 years old. She is married and has three children between the ages of five and ten. Two of her children go to school. She is married and her husband sells various commodities in the local market. 

Frida sells goats and has had this business for five years. With this loan she will buy more goats to sell. With the profit from this business, she will renovate her house. 

Because her business is successful, Frida has been able to build a house and install electricity in it. She would like to make 92% return on her investments.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a beauty salon business from home for three months, passers-by, school children and neighbors are her customers. Naomi faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. When school children have opened, especially the month of January to May, she experiences low customers while during holiday season the month of August and December, she experiences high customer turn up. She hopes to expand her beauty salon business in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to start a vegetable selling business, purchase sacks of vegetables and fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To start a vegetable selling business, purchase vegetables and fruits for resale

loans.name: Mercy Ekua

texts.en: Mercy Ekua F. sells foodstuffs at Elmina. Mercy has been through junior high school. Her husband is a trader. She is asking to use the loan to buy more of the food items that are very often requested at her shop. She anticipates reinvesting her profit back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more popular food items to sell.

loans.name: Molleccato Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "MOLLECCATO"; la socia vive en el distrito de Urcos y provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Paulino: ella tiene 35 años de edad ella es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos;  la socia se dedica a la venta de comidas caseras en la plaza central de Urcos, ella tiene un stand de venta de comidas típicas de la zona. Ella tiene este negocio desde el año 2006, la socia desea incrementar sus ventas para lo cual ella solicita capital para comprar los insumos y también platos y cubiertos para su negocio ambulatorio. La socia solicita le préstamo para comprar insumos y cubiertos para su negocio.

Los socios se dedican a la crianza de animales menores, la venta de comida, al transporte (triciclos) llevar carga pesada a los mercados y otros lugares; a la venta de productos secos, obrero.
La socia agradece el préstamo que se le otorgará y se compromete a seguir trabajando con mucho ahincó para cumplir con los pagos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
This partner is s member of the Molleccato community bank. She  lives in the Urcos district in the Quispicanchis province, deparment of Cusco. The partner is 35 year old Paulina, who is in a common-law marriage and has 3 children. She makes a living selling home-made food in the central plaza of Urcos, where she has a stand selling typical food. She has had this business since 2006 and wishes to increase her sales. To that end she requests a loan to buy ingredients as well as plates and silverware for her business. 

The other partners make a living by raising small animals, selling food, transportation (tricycle), carrying heavy cargo to other places and markets, selling dry goods, and as a general laborers. This partners is thankful for the loan and is committed to keep working hard to makes her payments and improve her business.

loans.use: This partner requests a loan to buy ingredients and silverware for her business

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa E. sells doughnuts and bread at Elmina. Adjoa has no educational background. She is married and has five dependants. Her husband is a security man. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. The loan will be used to buy more flour and other ingredients to prepare doughnuts and bread for sale. She hopes to reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: To buy more flour and other ingredients to prepare doughnuts and bread for sale.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: El Sr. Felix tiene 63 años de edad es casado  tiene 5 hijos ya mayores de edad, El y su familia viven en la calle Francisco pizarro Distrito de Parcona, en casa de material noble de un piso recien construido aun no esta con acabados.El se dedica como panificador y a la vez cuenta con una pequeña tienda en su casa el cual es apoyado por su esposa, ellos cuenta con el negocio hace 6 años. Cuentan con metas y objetivos uno de ellos es poder terminar de construir su casa. Con el dinero que solicita invertira para realizar algunos acabados de su vivienda.
texts.en: Felix is 63 years old, married and has 5 grown children.  He and his family live on Francisco Pizarro Street in the Parcona district in a one-story house made of solid materials.  This house was recently built and lacks finishing touches.  He is a baker, and at the same time has a small store in his house and his wife supports him in these activities.  They have had this business for 6 years.  One of their goals is to finish the construction on their house.  He will invest the money requested to finish the construction on his house.

loans.use: to do some finishing work on the construction of his house

loans.name: Esther Esi Kuwah

texts.en: Esther Esi kuwah N. sells maize in both smaller and larger quantities at Elmina. She has no educational background. She is married. She assists in the upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of maize to distribute to her increasing number of customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a storehouse.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize

loans.name: Grace Nyame Bekyere

texts.en: Grace Nyame Bekyere N. is divorced. She takes care of two children. She has been through junior high school. Grace is a seamstress and sells palm oil at Elmina as well. She has been in this business for 13 years.The loan will help her to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Grace plans to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Jazmin

texts.es:
Jazmín Ramírez de 29 años de edad, dice que su negocio inició debajo de un árbol a la intemperie, cuando solo contaba con una pequeña maquina para corte de cabello, un espejo, y eso si,  muchas ganas de salir adelante. Hoy en día y desde el año 2007, ella dice  que “es su propia jefa" y que su disciplina, dedicación y su buen humor, han sido los ingredientes de su crecimiento empresarial y personal. Ella cuenta con un local sillas, espejos, vitrinas lava cabezas, insumos y herramientas adecuadas, televisores para distraer a  sus clientes cuando esperan,  aunque trabaja en jornadas extendidas no desfallece, porque su familia es su motor e inspiración para hacer de cada día el mejor.
Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo el cual invertirá en su peluquería "Jehová Shalon" comprando   insumos como tintes, ampollas, masajes para cabello y enjuague, no solo para usarlo en su servicio, sino también para venderlos a sus clientes, a quienes además de prestarle el servicio,  los asesora, porque en materia de estilo y belleza Jazmín se las sabe todas y cada día se perfecciona mediante seminarios a los que asiste. Ella está muy contenta con su negocio, porque siempre está rodeada de clientes, que son sus vecinos, referidos, familiares,  amas de casa, jóvenes y niños y además porque el producto de este trabajo y el de su esposo,  le ayuda a aumentar los  ingresos familiares, con los cuales quieren brindar una educación con mucha calidad a sus  3 hijos que ahora están en las edades de 5 a 10 años.
 ,
texts.en:
Jazmín Ramírez, 29, says that she started her business outside under a tree.  She had only one small haircutting tool, a mirror, and a strong desire to get ahead.  Today, and since the year 2007, she says that "she is her own boss" and that discipline, dedication and a good sense of humor have been the foundations of her growth as a person and as a businesswoman.  She has a salon with chairs, mirrors, glass display cases, hair washing stands, supplies, adequate tools, and television sets to distract her customers as they wait.  Although she works very long days, she does not falter, because her family is her motivation and inspiration to make each day the best.

This is her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and she will invest it in her beauty salon, called "Jehová Shalon," by purchasing supplies such as: hair dyes, hair treatment ampules and hair massages and rinses, to use in her business and also to sell to her customers.  In addition to providing beauty services, Jazmin also advises her customers, because in the area of style and beauty Jazmin knows everything, and she is constantly improving her knowledge by attending seminars.  She is very content with her business, because she is always surrounded by her customers, who are her neighbors, relatives, referrals, housewives, young people and children.  In addition, as a result of this work and that of her husband, she can increase the family income and provide a quality education to her 3 children who are now between the ages of 5 and 10 years.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as hair dyes, ampules, hair massage, shampoo and rinse, not only to use in her salon but also to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mercy Aba Atta

texts.en: Mercy Aba Atta A. is married and has two children. She has received senior high education. Mercy is a hair dresser at Elmina. Her husband is a driver. Mercy uses the income she makes from her sales to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Mercy is asking to use the loan to purchase more hair creams to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mercy plans to reinvest into her business by purchasing more hair products.

loans.use: To purchase more hair creams to expand her business.

loans.name: Ledys Esther

texts.es:
Ledys R. es una confeccionista de 52 años que vive  en Villa del Carmen, un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Soledad; allí  tiene su negocio de fabricación de ropa en general, porque ella se mueve con todas las tallas y todas las líneas: femenina masculina e infantil.
Ella desde los 16 años inició haciendo su propia ropa y la de sus hermanas, y poco a poco fue incursionando en el ramo empresarial cuando empezó a trabajar en un taller, allí fue donde perfeccionó su arte y   cuando ya hubo conseguido muchos clientes, a quienes les gustaba su forma de trabajar,  inició su  microempresa con ellos.  Este es el segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el planea comprar materias primas e insumos para confeccionar sobre medidas   y  artículos como encajes, telas e hilos para venderlos.
Su primer crédito con esta organización lo aprovecho mucho,  porque con el logró tener un capital suficiente  para hacer vestidos y venderlos. Su sueño es tener un almacén especializado en los productos que fabrica   y que  adicionalmente venda   todo lo relacionado con esta actividad, para que los clientes que mandaren a fabricar sus vestidos, pueda comprar la tela que le guste  para su fabricación. El  negocio en la vida e Ledys ha sido muy importante,  porque con él ha logrado sostener  su familia conformada por sus dos hijos de 9 y 26 años de edad,  con los que sueña ver  muy prósperos en un futuro no muy lejano.
texts.en:
Ledys R. is a dressmaker.  She is 52 years old and lives in Villa del Carmen, a neighborhood located in the town of Soledad.  There she has her workshop where she makes clothes.  She makes all sizes and lines of clothing; women's, men's, and children's.

She started out 16 years ago making clothes for herself and for her sisters.  Little by little she started to set foot in the business world when she began to work in a workshop.  That was where she perfected her art and when she had acquired a lot of customers who liked her work, she set up her small business.  This is the second loan which she has had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to use it to buy raw materials and supplies for made-to-measure clothes and articles such as laces, fabrics and thread to sell.

She took full advantage of her first loan with this organization because with it she managed to acquire sufficient capital to make dresses and sell them.  Her dream is to have a store for the products which she makes and to sell everything related to this activity so that her customers who ask her to make dresses can choose the material they want.  This business has been very important in Ledys' life because through it she has managed to support her family of two children, aged 9 and 26.  She hopes to see them do very well in the not-so-distant future.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and supplies for making made-to-measure clothes, as well as articles such as lace, fabric and thread to sell

loans.name: Gladys Adjoa Safia

texts.en:
Gladys Adjoa Safia C. sells raw gari and maize at Elmina. Gladys is married and has four children. Her husband is a mechanic. Gladys has been in this trade for some time now. She assists her husband in providing the basic needs of the family, such as food, shelter and clothing. Her loan will be used to buy more gari and maize to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to educate her children.

In this photo, Gladys is displaying the maize she sells.

loans.use: To buy more gari and maize to sell.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 58 years old and is in business. She does bead work at her home where she makes bags, purses, wallets, and necklaces, among other products. 

She began this business last year and describes her business environment as convenient. She has requested a loan of Kes. 20,000 to stock different types of beads and threads. She also does quarrying to earn extra income. 

She was formerly employed as an elementary school teacher and later at the Lyons maid company. A mother of six adults (all over 18 years of age), Damaris is married and one of her children is in schoool. 

She describes herself as hard-working, honest and responsible.  She hopes to buy her own house so as to stop renting, and have children who are financially independent. 

In five years time, Damaris desires to have numerous orders for her products, have a premises to operate her business and employ people. Since joining Faulu Kenya, Damaris has become a good saver.

loans.use: To buy beads and threads

loans.name: Jerusalem Cruz Blanca Group

texts.es:
Jerusalém    cruz blanca
Este grupo está   conformada por Doña Amalia B. siendo la líder del grupo y por Adela C.  y Josefina quienes tienen grandes sueños ya que con el crédito desean progresar en sus negocios Amalia quiere invertir más en la compra de productos comestibles  como lo es el maíz ya que por la tormenta Ágata que sacudió hace pocos días Guatemala , éste ha subido su costo ya que la mayor parte de la plantación se ha perdido por lo  que se vio en la necesidad de solicitar este crédito para la compra del maíz, Doña Adela por su parte tiene una venta de Flores y Verduras por los pueblos y aldeas muy alejadas de la ciudad capital por  lo que ella quisiera invertir en la ocmpra de verduras  y así poder vender un poco mes  a las personas, Doña Josefina se dedica a la fabricación de muebles junta mente con su esposo desde  varios años, por lo que necesita el dinero para invertirlo en tela para tapizar los mismos  ya que la temporada navideña es donde tienen más demanda de muebles decorativos de  todo tipo. Son mujeres  muy trabajadoras por lo que ven su futuro mejor con esfuerzo y dedicación al lado de sus familias.
texts.en:
Jerusalém cruz blanca (Jerusalem White Cross)
This group has the following members:  Doña Amalia B. who is the leader of the group, Adela C. and Josefina.  They have big dreams and would like to use this loan to make progress in their businesses.  Amalia would like to invest more in the purchase of foodstuffs such as corn.  As a result of Tropical Storm Ágata which shook Guatemala recently the price of corn has risen since most of the plantations were lost.  For this reason, she needs to request this loan to buy corn.

Doña Adela has a business selling flowers and vegetables in the towns and villages which are furthest from the capital city.  She would like to invest in buying vegetables and thereby be able to sell a little more to people.   Doña Josefina has had a furniture-making business with her husband for several years.  She needs money to invest in material for covering the pieces of furniture since the Christmas period is when they have most demand for decorative furniture of all kinds.  They are all hard-working women who see a better future for themselves and their families through hard work and dedication.

loans.use: Foodstuffs, vegetables and fabric for covering furniture

loans.name: Yaa Nana

texts.en: Yaa Nana T. sells smoked fish at Elmina. She has received a junior high education. She is single. Demand for her fish is high and she is looking to expand her business. The loan will be used to buy more fish to smoke and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Yaa wishes to purchase land.

loans.use: To buy more fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a married man with four children, three of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent bills.

She has operated a bodaboda( motorbike) business for over three years, her potential customers are passersby and neighbours. Mohamed faces a challenge of transportation because of high cost of fuel. He hopes to purchase another motorbike in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access financial services.

loans.use: To purchase spareparts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Robinson

texts.es: Desde hace 20 años Robinson López viene construyendo su experiencia en el comercio informal, él inició vendiendo gorras y relojes,  y desde el año 2006 añadió electrodomésticos, pero como la era de la tecnología lo revolucionó todo, ahora no solo vende electrodomésticos sino también controles remotos, celulares y hasta presta también el servicio de mantenimiento y reparación de estos equipos. Poco a poco y adaptándose a los cambios, Robinson ha logrado sostener su negocio y también su hogar conformado por su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 12 y 15 años, por los que aun debe trabajar mucho,  para que ellos logren una buena educación a nivel profesional.  Como su sueño es ampliar el negocio para seguirse moviendo en el mercado con mayor amplitud, y ajustado a las oportunidades, está solicitando su credikiva,  pues planea comprar con él, controles para televisión, DVD, aires acondicionados y Compact disk de música y de películas. En la actualidad su capital de trabajo es de $1.795.000 COP, su rentabilidad sobre las ventas es de 34,56%, y su margen de utilidad es de un 12%. Robinson es un hombre muy contento que interactúa en un espacio comercial, caracterizado por una competencia sana entre iguales, lo que le permite la debida interacción comercial y especialmente la cooperación con otros negocios muy cercanos con las misma características mercadológicas.
texts.en: For 20 years Robinson López has been building his experience in informal commerce.  He started out selling caps and watches and in 2006 he added electrical appliances.  However, as the technological age has revolutionized everything, he now no longer sells only electrical appliances but also remote controls, cell phones and he even provides maintenance and repair services for this equipment.  Little by little, adapting to changes, Robinson has managed to sustain his business and also his household which consists of his wife and his 2 children aged 12 and 15.  He still needs to work hard for his children so that they can achieve a good professional-level education.  As his dream is to expand his business in order to continue moving in the market and adjusting to opportunities, he is requesting this Kiva loan.  With it he plans to buy television controls, DVDs, air conditioners, music CDs and movies.  His current working capital is $1,975,000 Colombian pesos.  His profitability on his sales is 34.56% and his profit margin is 12%.  Robinson is a very happy man who works in a commercial space characterized by a healthy competition between equals which allows him to interact and cooperate with other nearby businesses with the same market characteristics.

loans.use: Television controls, DVDS, air conditioners, music CDs and movies

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 27-year-old businessman who does quarrying for a living. He has been in this business since 2008 and describes the business environment as friendly. 

His main customers are real estate developers and business is good since his business is located in a developing area. He has requested a loan of Kes. 40,000 to purchase more mining tools and pay his workers. 

Henry is married and they are parents to two young children. He describes himself as honest, hard-working and obedient, and hopes to educate his children, build a home and accumulate wealth. 

In five years, Henry desires to have the capacity of supplying building materials to a wider range of customers, and own his own lorries.

loans.use: To purchase mining tools and pay workers

loans.name: Theresa Ekua Yasah

texts.en: Theresa Ekua Yasah A. is divorced. She has not received any form of education. Theresa sells fruit and soap at Elmina. Demand for her goods is high and she is looking to expand her business by buying more fruit to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Theresa plans to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Comfort Ama Madwen Moho

texts.en: Comfort Ama Madwen Moho G. sells banku, plastic bowls and saucepans at Elmina. Comfort has no educational background. She is married to an electrician. She assists her husband in the well-being of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more plastic bowls and pans to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more plastic bowls and pans to sell.

loans.name: Helena Ekua Jasiwa

texts.en: Helena Ekua Jasiwa B. is married and has a child. Helena has been through junior high school. She sells polythene bags at Elmina. Helena uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Helena wants to use the loan to purchase more polythene bags to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Helena plans to save towards her child’s education.

loans.use: To purchase more polythene bags to sell.

loans.name: Mavis Baaba Yaa

texts.en:
Mavis Baaba Yaa A. is married and has two children. She has no educational background. She operates a beauty salon. She sometimes moves around in the locality to fix the nails of her customers. Her husband is a trader. Mavis assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She is asking to use the loan to purchase products to use on her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mavis plans to educate her children.

Mavis is displaying the nail polish (Cutex) she uses on her clients.

loans.use: To purchase products to use on her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a motor for his vehicle

loans.name: Mayte

texts.es:
Mayte vive en la casa de sus abuelos cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de el alto zona ciudad satélite. Ella tiene una tienda de barrio ubicada en el mismo domicilio. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. Ella no tiene hijos, vive con sus abuelos. 
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de Abarrotes como azúcar, arroz y fideo. Esto le permitirá aumentar su capital y ofrecer los productos a sus clientes.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro y el análisis socio-económico permite ver que Mayte está calificada para obtener un préstamo.
texts.en:
Mayte lives at her grandparents’ house which is located in an area adjacent to the city of El Alto. She manages a neighborhood store in her home. This is the main source of income by which she supports herself. Mayte does not have children and lives with her grandparents.

The loan will be used to buy groceries such as sugar, rice, and noodles. This will enable her to increase her capital and offer products to her customers. Mayte is receiving her first loan from IMPRO and the socio-economic analysis indicates that she is qualified to receive this loan.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice, and noodles

loans.name: Lidia Veronica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE COYLLORITTI DE CCORAO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Corao, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Lidia Verónica; ella tiene 25 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella vende todo tipo de textilería como mantas, alfombras, la socia vende en las ferias que se realizan en el distrito de Corao, ella trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía al por mayor.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Lidia Verónica is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Coylloritti de Ccorao”, which is located in the District of Corao, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 25 years old and a single mother with one child. Lidia Verónica divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling handicrafts. She sells all types of textiles such as blankets and rugs. Lidia Verónica sells at the fairs held in the District of Corao. She works from 9am until 6pm. Lidia Verónica wants to expand her business, so she is requesting a loan to buy handicrafts in bulk.

She is grateful to those who helped fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase handicrafts in bulk to sell

loans.name: Dennis

texts.es:
Dennis vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Achumani, de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y trabaja como empleado en una oficina particular con cuyos ingresos que obtiene se mantiene.

 El anterior crédito fue utilizado para la refacción del patio de su vivienda. El señor se encuentra satisfecho con los créditos que le otorgamos. Ahora solicita un nuevo préstamo para refaccionar el techo de plástico del solarium de la casa donde vive.

Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito y se considera buen cliente.
texts.en:
Dennis lives at his parents’ house in the District of Achumani of the city of La Paz. He is single and works as an employee for a private business. The income he earns enables him to support himself.

His previous loan was used to repair the patio of his home. Sr. Dennis is pleased with the loans he has received. Now he is requesting a new loan so that he can repair the plastic roof over the sun room in his house.

His prior history qualifies him for a new loan since he is considered to be a good client.

loans.use: Repair the roof over the sun room in his parents' house

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix vive en casa propia en la zona Reyes Carvajal, de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y su hija; es casado.

 Felix es empleado de la alcaldía de esta ciudad y su esposa vende hamburguesas en un puesto callejero; con los ingresos que obtienen de ambas actividades mantienen a la familia. Esta es la primera vez que presenta una solicitud de créditos. El dinero solicitado será utilizado en la construcción de un muro de contención de su casa.

Por su estudio socio económico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Felix lives in his own home in the District of Reyes Carvajal of the city of La Paz with his wife and daughter. He is married.

Felix is a city employee while his wife sells hamburgers from a street cart. With the income they earn from both of their jobs, they are able to support their family. This is the first time Felix has applied for a loan. The money he requested will be used to build a retaining wall for his house.

The socio-economic analysis indicates he is qualified to receive this new loan.

loans.use: Build a retaining wall for his house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase fabrics

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe - Chupaca Group

texts.es:
MarianeL. M. L., socia integrante D. L. Alcom "Virgen D. Guadalupe - Chupaca" (es L. segunda persona, empezando desD. L. izquierda; lleva un gorro color gris), elL. es madre soltera con dos niños D. 08 y 03 años D. edad respectivamente; se separò D. su esposo debido a los maltratos fìsicos que recibìa, por ello su madre siempre a sido su apoyo moral y en muchas ocasiones economico; ya que su esposo se desinteresò en darle apoyo econommico para sus hijos. 
Su madre le regalò 02 gallinas y 04 cuyes, y con eso MarianeL. iniciò su negocio D. crianza D. animales en su propio hogar, donD. le permitiera cuidar a sus menores hijos. Actualmente cuenta con 40 unidades D. cuyes y 30 unidades D. gallinas; los cuales han servido D. fuente D. ingreso para su subsistencia.

(L. persona que esta detras del grupo, es madre D. una D. las socias)

El credito otorgado a MarianeL., lo utilizara para comprar cerdos e incluir D. este modo L. venta D. cerdos a su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
MarianeL. M. L. is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen D. Guadalupe – Chupaca”. (She is the second person on the left wearing a gray cap.) She is a single mother with two children, ages 8 and 3 respectively. MarianeL. separated from her husband because of physical abuse, so her mother has provided her with both moral and financial support on several occasions. Her husband shows no interest in providing financial support for their children.

MarianeL.’s mother gave her two hens and four guinea pigs. She started a business raising animals from her home so that she could care for her young children. MarianeL. currently has 40 guinea pigs and 30 hens to generate income for her own subsistence.

(The woman standing behind the group is the mother of one of the members.)

The loan being provided to MarianeL. will be used to buy pigs so that she can sell them as part of her small business.

loans.use: Purchase pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Araba Fynjoyce

texts.en: Araba Fynjoyce S. sells tomatoes and plastic bowls at Elmina. Araba has no educational background. She is divorced and has four children. She has been in this trade for seven years now. She ensures the well-being of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more plastic bowls and containers to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: To buy more plastic bowls and containers to sell.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR D. COYLLORITTI D. CCORAO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Corao, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco  y departamento D. Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Manuela; ella tiene 67 años D. edad y es viuda y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. picantería donD. venD. chicha (bebida a base D. maíz) y también algunos platos D. comida, ella atienD. desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio cambiando el ambiente D. la picantería (es como un restaurant mas tradicional). La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar para la picantería.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Manuela is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor D. Coylloritti D. Ccorao”, which is located in the District of Corao, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 67 years old, widowed, and has six children. Manuela divides her time between her daily activities and her restaurant business where she sells “chicha” (a beverage maD. of corn) and a few food items. She manages her business between 8am and 5pm. Manuela wants to improve her business by changing the ambience of her restaurant (since it has more traditional décor). She is requesting a loan to buy products for cooking to use in her restaurant.

Manuela is grateful to those who helped fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Sabina Ama Tawiah

texts.en: Sabina Ama Tawiah C. is married and has four children. She has junior high level of education. Sabina smokes fish at Ntranoa near Elmina. Sabina uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Sabina is requesting to use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sabina plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Agnes Nana Ama Atta

texts.en: Agnes Nana Ama Atta D. is married and has seven dependents. She has received junior high education. Agnes produces and sells 'Fante kenkey' (fermented corn dough) at Elmina. Her husband works in carpentery. Agnes uses her income in assisting her husband to take care of the family. The loan will be added to her initial capital to increase production to meet the demand of her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: add to her initial capital to increase production

loans.name: Las Mercedes 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.es:
Paula es una de los miembros del Grupo Las M. 1, 2 & 3; un grupo de mujeres y hombres empresarios dedicados a las ventas de productos, zapatos, ropas, y servicios; sus negocios están localizados en La ciudad de Samana, cuya economía depende del sector turístico e inmobiliaria, es un destino turístico emergente, en donde como muchas hay escasez de agua potable y de energía eléctrica y con una población de dominicanos y emigrantes haitianos. Nuestra asociada Paula tiene un salón de belleza es una madre que vive con 3 hijos, y su pareja sentimental; nos dice que su reto o desafío más difícil es comprarse un vehículo para poder moverse y hacer sus diligencias. Disfruta mucho trabajar en su salón y atender a sus clientes.

Paula está muy emocionada de recibir su octavo préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente sus préstamos anteriores y así haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 3 años, el cual inició trabajando en el salon de una amiga y mientras ahorraba pudo aprender y realizar su sueño. Está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra algunos equipos para su salon como un sillon y varios productos. Planea utilizar sus ganancias para hacer algunas mejoras en su vivienda y seguir ahorrando. Su sueño es poder viajar por varios paises, expandir sus conocimientos y poder tambien negociar trayendo diversos productos.
texts.en:
Paula is a member of the group Las M. 1, 2 & 3. It is a group of enterprising men and women that sell products, shoes, clothing and services. Their businesses are located in the city of Semana whose economy depends on the tourism and real estate sectors. It is an emerging tourist destination and like  many other areas, there is a shortage of drinking water and electricity. It has a Dominican population as well as a population of Haitian immigrants.One of its members, Paula, has a beauty salon and is a mother who lives with her three children and her partner. Her biggest challenge is buying a car in order to get around do her errands. She greatly enjoys working at her salon and attending to her clients. 

Paula is very happy to receive her eighth loan with field partner Esperanza Internacional after having satisfactorily paid her previous loans and thus moved forward in with the growth of her business. She has had her business for about three years. She was able to start her business after working at a friend's salon where she could save and learn about the business. She is planning on investing her new loan in purchasing equipment for her salon such as a chair and various products. She plans on using her profits to make improvements to her home and to keep saving. Her dream is to be able to travel to various countries, to expand her knowledge and to be able to negotiate so she can bring back various products.

loans.use: Purchase equipment for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Elizabeth Maame Yawa

texts.en:
Elizabeth Maame Yawa A. sells fish and as well cooking oats in the mornings for sale at Elmina. Elizabeth has received junior high education. She is a single parent taking care of seven dependents. Elizabeth is asking to use the loan to enable her to expand her business. She ensures that the general needs of her family are provided for. She plans to educate her children with the additional income. 

In this picture, Maame had already prepared the oats she was going to sell that morning.

loans.use: enable her to expand her business

loans.name: Christiana Davi Akponah

texts.en: Christiana Davi Akponah G. operates a food joint (a place where people come to eat) near Ntranoa at Elmina. She has attained a senior high level of education. Christiana is married to a prison officer. Demand for her food is high and she is looking to expand her business. She plans to reinvest the new profits into her business, so she can increase her operations.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Kankalay Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Kankalay” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Salamatu K.. Salamatu is age 55 and was born in Magburaka town. She is a widow with four children. Three of her children are attending secondary schools.  For many years now, Salamatu has been selling palm oil, bars of soap, charcoal, etc. With the help of this loan, Salamatu is going to expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, bars of soap, charcoal, etc. in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Baido Comfort Araba

texts.en: Baido Comfort Araba D. is married and has four children. She has received a junior high education. Baido sells provisions and secondhand clothing at Elmina. She has been in this business for 15 years. Her husband is a policeman. She assists her husband in the general well-being of the home. The loan will enable her to increase the supply of her goods for her customers. She plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business.

loans.use: To increase the supply of her goods for her customers.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama M. is married and has received a junior high education. Ama sells fish at Elmina. Her husband is a security man. Demand for her fish is increasing and she is requesting to use the loan to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Comalapenses Group

texts.es:
MUJERES COMALAPENSES

MARIA TERESA M. S..
 
 ella tiene 58 años de edad,ES LA LIDER DEL GRUPO  tiene un hijo que le ayuda mensualmente en sus gastos, ella se dedica ala venta de productos de comestibles y tambien  a la venta de helados hace varios años que se dedica a esta actividad, pertenece a un grupo de Bcos. Pero ahora por la epoca de fin de año necesita un credito para poder comprar mas mercaderíae comestibles  para surtir mejor su negocio.

GLENDA AMARILIS L. M.
tiene 23 años de edad, tiene un hijo es madre soltera, ella se dedica a la elaboración de guipiles a mano y tambien fajas tejidas a mano necesita su credito para poder comprar materia prima para poder elaborar mas producto porque en esta epoca hay demanda de su producto.

CRISTOBALINA S. C..

tiene 35 años de edad, es Perito Contador, pero por falta de empleo no ha podido trabajar en su profesion, ella tiene 2 niños pequenos, ella se dedica a la elaboración de delantales bordados a maquina, desde hace 3 años que se dedica a esa actividad, ella necesita su credito para  obtener materia prima para mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
MUJERES COMALAPENSES

MARIA TERESA M. S..
Maria Teresa, 58, is the group's leader.  She has a S. who helps her with monthly expenses.  Maria Teresa has operated a business selling everyday commodities, along with ice cream, for several years.  She belongs to a lending group and needs a loan to buy merchandise to stock her grocery business.

GLENDA AMARILIS L. M.
Glenda, 23, is the single mother of one child.  She operates a business making and selling "guipiles" and "fajas" (traditional items of clothing for women).  Demand for Glenda's products increases this time of year and she is applying for a loan to buy the materials she needs to make them.

CRISTOBALINA S. C..
Cristobalina, 35, is a trained bookkeeper but, because there's no work, she can't work in the profession.  She has 2 young children.  She has operated a business making and selling machine-stitched smocks for 3 years.  She is applying for a loan to buy materials for the business and, ultimately, to increase her income.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida N. is into the production and sale of palm oil at Elmina. Vida has been through junior high school. She is married and lives together with her four children. Vida has been selling palm oil for 12 years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She wishes to increase the production of her palm oil. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: To increase the production of her palm oil.

loans.name: Calacoto Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “Calacoto” se ha agrupado para sacar su primer crédito como socias del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Esta B.C. está compuesta por diez socias.  Ellas tienen diferentes negocios y han conformado un banco comunal para recibir servicios de salud, crédito y capacitación.  Los negocios que tienen son venta de verduras, tejido de aguayo, venta de papa, tejido de mantas, venta de ollas, confección de alfombras, venta de medias, venta de ollas y tejido de mantas.

La presidenta se llama Celestina Q. es una mujer joven de 28 años de edad, está iniciando su hogar con su pareja, su negocio es el de venta de verduras.  Ella realiza esta venta en un puesto desde hace un año, su solicitud de crédito es por Bs.2000.- para la compra de verduras por mayor y venta diaria en su puesto.
texts.en:
The Calacoto community bank was formed by members of the German Busch Focus Center to apply for a first loan.  The bank has ten members who operate various businesses.  They formed the group to gain access to health, lending and training skills.  Businesses operated by the members include vegetable sales, making and selling traditional textiles called "aguayo", weaving and selling blankets, cookware sales, rug-making, and clothing sales.

Celestina Q. is the president of the community bank.  She is a young woman, 28, just starting her own family with her partner.  Celestina operates a vegetable sales business.  She started the business a year ago and is now applying for a Bs.2000 (2,000 bolivianos) loan to buy wholesale supplies of vegetables to stock her business.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PUNTUALITO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Martha; ella tiene 38 años de edad, casada  y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes vendiendo productos de primera necesidad como son azúcar, arroz, leche  y a la vez tiene un transporte de servicio público siendo quien maneja su esposo, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00am hasta las 10:00pm . La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su tienda de abarrotes y para el mantenimiento de su carro.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el pL. establecido.
texts.en:
Our member, Martha, belongs to the PUNTUALITO community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.  

Martha, 38, is married and has 3 children.  She juggles her day between two businesses: a corner shop--selling everyday commodities like sugar, rice and milk--and a taxi business that she operates with her husband.  She works from 7:00am to 10:00pm.  She is applying for a loan to stock her business and for auto maintenance.  

Martha is grateful to everyone who has made this means of borrowing possible and is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: Stock grocery business.

loans.name: Hope To God Ii Group

texts.en:
Posseh K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Posseh was born in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. She is 28 years of age. Posseh is married to a trader and the couple has two children who are attending primary school. For 10 years now, Posseh has been selling used clothes.

This is first the loan that Posseh and her group members have applied for from Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and, consequently, improve their living conditions. Posseh will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to expand her business. She will buy a bale or two of used clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy a bale or two of used clothes to add to her current stock

loans.name: Benijean

texts.fr:
Client tres remarquable par ses strategies de travail, il a ete tres efficace dans le remboursement du premier pret et a realise des epargnes considerables.
Ayant au depart un fond de commerce tres minime, avec le second pret de 350.000 frs CFA , il a encore elargi sa boutique et a renforce le stock des marchandises en achetant des cartons de tomates, conserves, lait , des sacs de sucre... et tout produit necessaire pour ses clients.

L'impact est tres considerable et le changement est visible dans sa vie de famille et sociale.
Pour ce qui est de ses deux enfants, pour cette annee scolaire, ils ont ete place dans une bonne ecole privee et pour sa femme, les cours pour l'apprentissage de la couture ont ete realise.

Tres pragmatique, il tient a aller au bout de ses ambitions avec HOPE, pour atteindre son objectif celui d'etre un homme d'affaire celebre un jour
texts.en:
This customer has outstanding business strategies. He has repaid his loan very efficiently, putting away considerable savings. Having only minimal starting capital, after his second loan of 350,000 West African francs he was able to further expand his store and increase his merchandise stock purchasing boxes of tomatoes, canned food, milk, bags of sugar…and other products needed by his customers. 

The impact of his business is considerable, and his family’s social conditions have visibly improved thanks to it. As concerns his two children, for this school year he has been able to enroll them in a good private school; as to his wife, she has been able to take sewing courses. Very pragmatic, he is set to achieve his goals with HOPE, and one day he would like to become a well-known businessman.

loans.use: Purchasing boxes of canned food and strengthening his business in general

loans.name: Luna De Oro Group

texts.es:
LUNA DE ORO

JOSE DAVID C. S.. el tiene 30 años de edad tiene una hija pequeña, el se dedica a la venta de tortillas con carne, y panes con carne, tiene una su carreta, y vende en el mercado, con el apoyo de su esposa obtiene mejores ventas, necesita su credito para poder ampliar su venta de comida y tambien  siembra arveja china.


JULIAN PABLO M. S.. 
el tiene 42 años de edad, el se dedica a la elaboración de puertas ventanales de estructuras
metalicas carretas para venta de comida  y tambien taller de carpintería, el tiene su taller en su casa en la aldea, tiene 4 hijos, los tiene estudiando,nececita el credito para ampliacion de su carpinteria  para poder obtener mejores ventas.

OSCAR DAVID C. S.
tiene 23 años de edad, no tiene ningun hijo es recien casado , el se dedica a la venta de tortillas con carne por las tardes, y tambien a ala agricultura siembre arveja china, su credito lo necesita para ampliar su venta de comida
texts.en:
LUNA DE ORO

JOSE DAVID C. S.. 
Jose, 30, has a young daughter.  He operates a business selling meat wrapped in tortillas or bread.  He has a cart and sells at a local market.  His wife helps him with the business and together they've increased sales.  Jose is applying for a loan so that he can expand the food business with part of the funds and plant peas with the rest.

JULIAN PABLO M. S.. 
Julian, 42, operates a business building parts for food carts.  He's also a carpenter.  Julian has 4 children, all in school, and he's applying for a loan to expand his carpentry business and, in turn, increase his income.

OSCAR DAVID C. S.
Oscar, 23, is recently married.  He works selling meat wrapped in tortillas in the afternoon.  He also grows peas for extra income.  Oscar is applying for a loan to expand his food business.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
Sra. Ana Marìa S. M., socia D. la Alcancia "Virgen D. Fàtima" (en la foto, es la primera empezando por la izquierda; està sonriente y entusiasta por la inaguraciòn D. este grupo).
Ana Maria lleva años en este negocio, sus principios fueron duros; tras el nacimiento D. su hija Kimberly. 
Ana Marìa empezò a repartir periòdicos junto a su esposo Don Cèsar Baltazar Castro, pues por la necesidad D. mantener el hogar trabajaban desD. tempranas horas D. la madrugada, ya que ellos hasta hoy tienen que hacer cola para recoger sus periòdicos. Poco a poco fueron ahorrando y juntaron para comprar un kiosko para trabajar cerca D. casa; asì trabajaban y ahorraban hasta lograr comprar un segundo kiosko que pudieron ubicarlo en una zona màs cèntrica y con mas concurrencia D. pùblico. Con el esfuerzo D. ello, su hija este año podrà festejar su cumpleaños numero 15 a mediados del presente mes, en una ceremonia sencilla al lado D. sus seres queridos.

El prèstamo que han solicitado es para incrementar y diversificar sus revistas; ademas D. adicionar la venta D. golosinas.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Maria S. M. is a member of the Virgen D. Fatima community bank.  (Ana Maria is on the left in the photo; she's smiling and excited to be part of this new group.)

Ana Maria has operated a business for several years.  The first years, after the birth of her daughter, Kimberly, were tough.  She started out delivering newspapers with her husband, Don Cesar Baltazar Castro.  In order to pay the family's bills, they had to start very early in the morning because even now they have to get in line before dawn to pick up their papers.  Little by little, they saved and pulled enough money together to buy a kiosk near their house; then they worked and saved until they had enough money to buy a second kiosk that they set up in a more central location so they could capture more passers-by.  Because of the business, they can celebrate their daughter's 15th birthday later this month, an important milestone for a young Peruvian woman, and one they'll celebrate with those closest to them.

Ana Maria will use part of the loan to increase the number and titles of magazines she sells.  She will use the other  part of buy snacks that she will resell.

loans.use: Stock products for retail business.

loans.name: Lane-Kuru Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Lane-Kuru” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Fatmata K. is the leader of this group. The 32-year-old is married to a businessman and they have two children who are attending primary school. Fatmata has been a businesswoman for three years now; she sells rice. With her share of this loan, she will buy bags of rice to sell.

loans.use: buy bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Luchando Por El Progreso 3 Group

texts.es:
Ana es una de los miembros del Grupo Luchando por el progreso 3; localizado en Los Alcarrizos ubicada al norte de la ciudad de Santo Domingo y es muy industrializada, y con una gran población que también dependen del las empresas y economía de la ciudad principal, en donde como muchas otras ciudades hay escasez de agua potable y de energía eléctrica y con una población de dominicanos y emigrantes haitianos. Esta asociada de Esperanza se dedicará al negocio de librería y venderá  de libros y artículos cristianos. Ana es casada y su familia esta compuesta por 4 hijos, de los cuales solo 1 vive actualmente con ellos, nos dice que sus retos o desafíos más difícil siempre ha podido salir adelante por lo que han sido varios que ha logrado superar, disfruta mucho enseñar a los demas, por lo que es su actividad favorita.

Ana está muy emocionada de recibir su primer préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, y con este desea poder salir adelante y lograr tener un negocio exitoso. Ella iniciara su negocio con este préstamo, al ver la necesita que tiene su comunidad de una librería cristiana. Está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de varias artículos de librería como libros, objetos, biblias entre otros con sentido cristiano. Esta Planeando utilizar sus ganancias para invertir en su negocio y de este modo poder ahorrar para seguir ayudando a sus hijos en lo que necesiten y poder tener ahorros para cuando ya no pueda trabajar.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the group "Luchando por le Progreso 3" which translates to "Fighting for Progress".  The group is in Los Alcarrizos which is located north of the city of Santo Domingo which is a very industrialized city with a large population. Los Alcarrizos is dependent on the companies and economy of Santo Domingo. Like in many other cities, Los Alcarrizos has a shortage of drinking water and electricity and counts with a Dominican population as well as a population of Haitian immigrants. Ana will dedicate herself to the bookstore and sell Christian books and articles. Ana is married and her family is made up of her four children of which only one currently lives with her. Her biggest challenges have been trying to get ahead but she has been able to overcome these. She likes to teach others which is why that is her favorite activity. 

Ana is very happy to be receiving her first loan with field partner Esperanza Internacional. With this loan she hopes to be able to get ahead and to have a successful business. She will start her business with this loan as she sees that her community needs a Christian bookstore. She plans on investing her loan in purchasing various bookstore items such as books, objects, bibles and other Christian things. She plans on using her profits to invest in her business and in this way she can save so that she can keep helping her children that need it and to save for the time when she can no longer work.

loans.use: Purchase 15 books, 15 Bibles and 20 books on Christian literature.

loans.name: Osman Alberto

texts.es: Osman Alberto tiene 27 años, su actividad económica es el destace de cerdo. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues desde muy joven busco la forma de mejorar su actividad. Es un joven muy emprendedor, por lo que siempre se preocupa por proporcionarle a su esposa e hijo lo más necesario, por lo que la mayoría de sus clientes conocen muy bien que él es un joven muy responsable con los productos que ofrece. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de cerdos y así destazarlos para realiza la elaboración de los derivados del cerdo. Su deseo es que su hijo logre convertirse en grandes profesionales.
texts.en: Osman Alberto is 27 years old and his economic activity is butchering pigs. He has dedicated himself to this business for over five years and since he was young he looked for a way to improve his business. He is a very enterprising young man and always worries about providing the necessities to his wife and child. The majority of his clients know that his very responsible with the products that he offers. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase pigs so that he can butcher them and make pork products. His hope is that his son is able to become a great professional.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Ervin Alexander

texts.es: Ervin tiene 35 años el se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, el vive con su familia en un municipio de Chichigalpa a pesar de que no tienen todas las comodidades el cada día se supera para proporcionarle a su familia lo necesario. Además que sale todos los días a ofrecer los productos que el compra para ofrecerlo. El es joven muy ejemplar pues además es un buen hijo y padre al mismo tiempo a pesar de que recorre muchos lugares siempre está contento de ofrecer a sus clientes lo mejor en calidad. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como cremas, pinturas, ropa en general entre otras cosas. Sueña con proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda y obtener otro medio de ingreso.
texts.en: Ervin is 35 years old and sells general merchandise. He has had this business for more than three years. He lives with his family in a town in Chichigalpa. Despite not having many amenities he strives every day to provide his family with the necessities. He goes out every day to offer the products he buys. He is an exemplary young man, he is a good son and father despite the fact that he has to travel to many places but he is always happy to offer his clients the best quality. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase supplies such as lotions, paints, clothing and other things. He dreams with improving his house and of obtaining another means of income.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Este es el segundo credikiva de Guillermo R. y con el comprará una nevera para conservar las carnes y verduras en buen estado  y volver a comprar antes de que se encarezcan los insumos que requiere  para hacer los pasteles de fin de año. Guillermo está muy contento porque las fiestas de fin de año le generaran un mayor volumen de ventas y una mejor rotación de su capital, y además porque comprará  en mayor volumen el aceite, el arroz, la sal, los condimentos  y las verduras  que requieren para producir en una mayor cantidad sus comidas. 
Si quiere conocer la historia de Guillermo usted puede ingresar al siguiente enlace:
http://www.kiva.org/lend/178874
texts.en:
This is Guillermo R.’s second Kiva loan.  He will use it to buy a refrigerator to keep meats and vegetables in good condition and will buy more before the ingredients he needs to make end of year cakes become scarce.

Guillermo is very happy because end of year festivities generate larger sales volume and better capital rotation and also because he will buy larger quantities of cooking oil, rice, salt, spices and vegetables that he needs to produce larger amounts of his dishes.

If you’d like to know Guillermo’s story, you may visit the following site: http://www.kiva.org/lend/178874

loans.use: He will buy a refrigerator to keep the meats and vegetables in good condition and will buy more before ingredients he needs to make end of year cakes become scarce.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos tiene 38 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio pues inicio como aprendiz, pues no tenía mucha experiencia en este tipo de negocio. Con el paso de tiempo es que ha fue aprendiendo este negocio que para él lo vio como una fuente de ingreso para un futuro y fue así como decide ofrecer este servicio a quienes lo necesitan, el se siente muy afortunado por la oportunidad. Este crédito lo utilizara para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas y detergentes. Sueña con terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, 38, has a grocery store.  He has had the business for over six years.  He started out as an apprentice because he didn’t have a lot of experience in this kind of work.  With the passage of time he gradually learned the business which he saw as a future source of income.  This is how he decided to provide this service to whoever needed it.  He feels very fortunate to have this opportunity.

He will use the funds to buy snacks, beverages, bread, cooking and detergent.  He dreams with finishing building his house.

loans.use: To buy stock items for the store.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is married and has five dependents. She has been through senior high school. Rose sells smoked fish at Elmina. Her husband is a security man. Rose uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Rose will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to further her children's education.

In this photo, Rose is standing beside her traditionally-built oven, showing the fish she has smoked for the day.

loans.use: purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Ekua Magaret

texts.en: Ekua Magaret O. sells charcoal at Elmina. Ekua has not received any formal education. She is married and takes care of six dependents. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of charcoal to meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy additional bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.use: buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE COYLLORITTI DE CCORAO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Corao, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Dionicia; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es divorciada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella vende toda clase de artesanía como chompas,collares,mantas,chalinas y pantalones, en una feria que se realiza los días martes y jueves en el distrito de Corao que queda a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Cusco, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m.la socia quiere ampliar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía como mantas y toda clase de textiles.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Dionicia, 39, is divorced and has two children.  She is a member of the “SEÑOR DE COYLLORITTI DE CCORAO” communal bank located in Corao district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She alternates her daily chores with crafts sales.  She sells all kinds of crafts like: sweaters, bracelets, blankets, scarves and pants in a market that takes place every Tuesday and Thursday in Corao district which is 20 minutes from the city of Cusco.

She works from 8am until 4pm.  She wants to expand her business and is asking for funds to buy more crafts, like blankets and all kinds of textiles.

She is grateful to all those who share in her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy crafts like blankets and all kinds of textiles.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi B. is into the production and sale of 'Fante kenkey' (fermented maize dough) at Elmina. Esi has received senior high education. She is married and has nine dependents. Her husband is a security man. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of maize to be able to produce "Fante kenkey' in large quantities. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a plot of land.

At the time of visit, Esi was preparinging a number of  the 'Fante kenkey' balls wrapped in banana leaves she was going to sell.

loans.use: buy more bags of maize

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose  is 45 years old. She is a widow and has four children who are between the ages of 13 and 26. Three of her children go to school and one completed vocational training. 

Speciose sells beans and peanuts, and has a milling machine. She has had this business for the last  two years. She needs this loan to buy more beans and peanuts to sell. 

From the profit, Speciose plans to renovate her house. Her business is successful and this has enabled her to provide for her family's needs.  

In the future she would like to expand her business and to rear cattle.

loans.use: To buy beans and peanuts for resale

loans.name: Groundnut Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Groundnut” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in order to seek a loan of SLL 3,100,000.00 for the entire group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Salamatu M.. Salamatu was born in a town called Kamakwe, in northern Sierra Leone. She is thirty-two years of ago. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a soldier and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. Salamatu sells locally produced goods and she has been a businesswoman for four years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy bags of groundnuts/peanuts to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy bags of groundnuts/peanuts to add to her business

loans.name: Redamta

texts.en: Redamta is 43 years old. She is a widow and has four children between the ages of eight and twenty. All her children go to school. Her husband has no job. Redamta sells goats and has had this business for three years. She is requesting this loan to buy more goats to sell.  She will save the money generated from this business as profit. Her business is very helpful because it has enabled her to meet her family needs. In the future, she would like to increase the number of goats she sells.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE COYLLORITTI DE CCORAO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Corao, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Victoria; ella tiene 34 años de edad y es divorciada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m y por medio de este pequeño negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche y detergentes al por mayor.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Victoria, 34, is divorced and has four children.  She is a member of the “SEÑOR DE COYLLORITTI DE CCORAO” communal bank located in Corao district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She alternates her daily chores with running a grocery store.  She sells basic needs items like rice, sugar and milk.  She works from 6am until 10pm and is able to support her children through this small business.  She’d like to enlarge and improve the grocery store and is asking for funds to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, cooking oil, milk and detergents at wholesale.

She thanks all those who share in her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like rice, sugar, cooking oil, milk and detergents at wholesale.

loans.name: Anatolia

texts.es: Anatolia, de 41 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Benjamín de 46 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Las chacras de Anatolia son las mejores cuidadas de su poblado, todas las mañanas, trabaja desde muy temprano en sus tierras, ya que sabe que de esta actividad dependen los ingresos de su familia, ella siembra cacao, café y hojas de coca, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender a la ciudad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para pasear por los verdes campos de su poblado, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus tierras de las plaga de insectos que perjudican sus plantaciones. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el décimo tercer crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de café y cacao, también invertirá en abono y fertilizantes naturales para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Anatolia, 41, is a very unassuming, hard working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Benjamín, 46, and their three beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better future.

Anatolia’s fields are the best cared for in her town.  Every morning she works them from very early in the morning because she knows that her family’s income depends on this activity.  She plants cocoa beans, coffee and coca leaves which she then takes to the city of San Francisco to sell.

What she enjoys most about the work is the freedom it gives her to work in her town’s the green fields.  She has been in this line of work for 15 years and considers the most difficult part of it to be keeping her crops safe from insect infestations that damage them.  In time, she’d like to buy more land to increase production.

This is her 13th loan with MFP and she expects to be very punctual with her repayments because she does not want to create problems for her communal bank in which she is very happy.

She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy coffee and cocoa bean seeds as well as manure and natural fertilizers for her crops.

loans.use: To buy coffee and cocoa bean seeds and sacks of fertilizers.
