Es una mujer muy trabajadora, ay que empezó muy joven para ayudar a su familia. Para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de venta de ropa y calzado en algún centro comercial. Es su segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece también a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, dinero comprará más mercadería en prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Vilma is 46 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and one of her two children.  She has been selling men’s and women’s casual clothing for the past year and she also sells all kinds of seasonal footwear.  She enjoys sales because she knows she has a strong power of persuasion that convinces customers to buy her merchandise.  Her business is very satisfying because she makes very good income that enables her to help her husband with the household expenses.  

Alongside her business, she also cares for elderly people, an almost full-time job which pays her very well.  She is a very hard-working woman who had to begin working at a very young age to help her family.  In the future, she plans to open a clothing and footwear store in a shopping center.  

This is her second loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support.  In addition, she is grateful to be a part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive.  She is also grateful to all those who will be managing the loan she is requesting as the funds will be very useful in advancing her business.  She will use the loan to buy more articles of clothing and merchandise for her business.

loans.use: To buy articles of clothing and merchandise.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un padre de familia de 47 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el distrito de Motupe, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provicia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de reparación de artículos de cuero en un pequeña renovadora que se encuentra ubicada en una de las principales calles de la zona en donde vive. El tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad y la calidad con la que arregla los zapatos, carteras y casacas que le encomiendan sus clientes han hecho que su negocio se haga conocido y que cuente con una clientela fija.

Pedro desea adquirir repuestos para poder brindar un buen servicio y por ende su cantidad de clientes aumente mas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su objetivo.

El es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por los pobladores de la zona en donde reside. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien tranquilo y bastante responsable.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 47 year old family man.  He lives with his wife and their children in the Motupe district.  It is an agricultural zone in the Lambayeque province.  It is one and a half hours from the city of Chilayo.

He repairs leather items in a small repair shop, which is on one of the main streets in the area where he lives.  The time he has spent working at this business activity, and the quality with which he fixes shoes, purses, and jackets that are entrusted to him by his customers, have made his business well known and given him fixed customers.

Pedro wishes to get repair items in order to be able to offer good service.  This will increase the number of customers that he has.  Therefore, he believes that it is advisable to request a loan for 1,800 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  This will help him meet his objective.

He is well-known and highly regarded by the people in the area where he lives.  People that know him consider him to be level-headed and very responsible.

loans.use: Buy repair items in order to improve his business

loans.name: Henrry Martín

texts.es:
Henrry tiene 40 años de edad, es soltero y reside en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de movimiento comercial considerable que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Henrry trabaja desde hace mas de tres años vendiendo accesorios y repuestos para mototaxis (vehículos motorizados que consisten en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina en donde se brinda servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros) estos vehículos se han constituido como el principal medio de transporte en la zona ya que son baratos y rápidos, por ello su negocio siempre cuenta con acogida por parte de sus clientes usuales.

El desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo mas accesorios y respuestos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de su negocio, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Henrry es una persona tranquila y responsable, el tiene muchas ganas de progresar y salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien honrado y confiable.
texts.en:
Henrry, age 40, is single and lives in the Olmos district.  It is an agricultural zone with considerable commercial activity in the Lambayeque province.  It is one hour and forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Henrry has been working for over three years selling accessories and replacement parts for “mototaxis” (motorized vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with a cabin attached to provide passenger and cargo transport).  These vehicles have been the main means of transportation in the area because they are cheap and fast.  That is why his business is always popular with his regular customers.

He wishes to expand his business by getting M. accessories and replacement parts.  He will do this to satisfy the demand in his business.  Therefore, he believes it is advisable to request a loan for 700 soles from Edpyme Alternativo.  This will help him achieve his objective.

Henrry is a level-headed and responsible person.  He has a big desire to progress and get ahead.  The people who know him consider him to be honorable and trustworthy.

loans.use: To buy accessories and replacement parts for mototaxis

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
Nicolasa es una madre D. familia D. 58 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su esposo en el anexo La Viña del distrito D. Oyotún, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace diez años a la comercialización D. productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega que se encuentra instalada en su vivienda. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos D. consumo diario que suelen ser D. difícil acceso dada su ubicación (a veinte minutos en vehículo del pueblo más cercano).

Su negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a la calidad D. productos que ofrece y al buen trato que brinda a sus clientes. Para satisfacer su demanda se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Nicolasa es una mujer D. buen carácter y bastante tranquila. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer emprendedora y con muchas ganas D. salir adelante.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is a 58 mother.  She lives with her husband in the La Viña settlement in the Oyotún district.  It is an agricultural area, which is one hour and thirty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For ten years she has been selling basic needs items and groceries from a store in her home.  She offers her customers diverse daily use items that are generally difficult to get given her location (twenty minutes by car to the nearest town).

Her business is very popular due to the quality of the products she sells and the good service she gives her customers.  In order to satisfy customer demand, she has seen the need to request a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  This will help her to achieve her objective.

Nicolasa is a woman of good character, and she is very level-headed.  The people who know her consider her to be an enterprising woman with a great desire to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy basic needs items and groceries to expand her store

loans.name: Maria Exilda

texts.en:
Maria is fifty-two years old.  She is married and has two children.  The family owns their own home.  They live in the village Sector Medio in the district of Tambogrande in the region of Piura.  It is a highly agricultural region in which many residents manage small mango or lime plantations and raise animals.

Both Maria and her husband inherited small properties from their parents.  These are currently planted with mango and rice and her husband works in their fields.  Additionally, Maria cares for a small herd of cattle at the home.  The cows provide milk which she sells to the municipality for local governmental programs.

This will be Maria’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  She plans to use the funds to purchase additional feed for her animals and additional fertilizer in order to maximize the crop yield on the family’s properties.  

Maria is a dedicated mother with big dreams for her family and children.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and fertilizer

loans.name: Yackelin

texts.es:
Yackelin es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Mensajeras” ubicado en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román, departamento de Puno, tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltera y no tiene hijos, la señorita sigue estudiando educación  superior.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 08 meses,  nos cuenta que su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de prendas deportivas.

La señorita solicitará un nuevo préstamo de  S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar materiales para la confección de ropas deportivas.
	
Su sueño es formar una gran empresa y tener sucursales en otros lugares.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la puntualidad y las charlas.
texts.en:
Yackelin is a member of the communal bank Las Mensajeras [The Messengers], located in the district of Juliaca, Province of San Roman, Puno.  She is 20 years old, single, and has no children.  She is also studying at university.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 08 months, and her first loan was 500 Nuevos Soles [approx. $180.00 US Dollars], which she used as capital in her sportswear sales business.

She is requesting a loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles so she can purchase material to make more sports clothing.

Her dream is to create a great company with branches in multiple locations.

What she likes most about her communal bank is their punctuality and the discussions they have.

loans.use: to buy material for the tailoring of sports clothing

loans.name: Maria Digna

texts.en:
Maria is thirty-nine years old.  She is married and has one seven-year-old child.  She and her family resiD. in the village of Sector Medio Partidor in the district of Las Lomas in the province of Piura.  They maintain a stable and happy home.

Maria manages a small restaurant, selling food out of a small eating area in the front of her home.  She sells regular planned meals as well as plates a la carte.  She has a number of regular clients to whom she provides meals and they pay on a monthly basis.  Her husband is retired from the ministry of agriculture.  He earns a pension which assists the family in meeting their needs.

This will be Maria’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  She plans to use the loan to purchase additional items for her restaurant in order to proviD. better service to her clients.  She also hope to be able to expand her daily sales by purchasing additional food on a regular basis.  

It is Maria’s dream that her child becomes a professional and attends good schools.  She is constantly working to proviD. for the family and to better their lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for restaurant business

loans.name: Maria Sabina

texts.en:
Maria is forty-eight years old.  She is a single mother and lives with her aging father and one of her sisters in the village of Los Mercedes Partidor in the region of Piura in northern Peru.  The family owns their own home and runs a small farm nearby.

Maria’s father is the owner of the farm.  She works on the land, raising rice, mango and limes.  She has spent the majority of her life as a farm laborer on this land and on other parcels in the area.  It is a productive region and provides the necessary resources to support the family.

The family currently needs a loan in order to purchase additional seed, fertilizer and pesticides in order to initiate a new crop of rice and improve the crop yield on their property.  Maria is taking out the loan and the father has signed as a guarantor.  They hope to be able to improve their lives and opportunities for Maria’s son by continuing to manage the farm and improve productivity.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Nazario

texts.es:
Nazario is thirty-seven years old.  He lives along with his wife and three children in a home in which they own.  Their home is located in the Valle de los Incas in the district of Tambogrande in the Province of Piura.  It is a lovely region with a large number of small farms of fruit trees and animal raising.

Nazario is owner of a 1.75 hectare property on which he raises mango and limes.  His wife is the owner of a 1 hectare property which is also used for farming.  Nazario works the fields and his wife cares for a number of animals near their home.  The have a number of sheep and two cows.

This is Nazario’s first loan from Edpyme Alternativa.  He plans to use the funds to purchase additional fertilizer for his farm and additional feed for the animals.  He dreams of expanding the family’s herd over time and purchasing additional land.  He hopes to be able to provide for his children education and provide them with more opportunities than he and his wife have had.
texts.en:
Nazario is thirty-seven years old.  He lives along with his wife and three children in a home in which they own.  Their home is located in the Valle de los Incas in the district of Tambogrande in the Province of Piura.  It is a lovely region with a large number of small farms of fruit trees and animal raising.

Nazario is owner of a 1.75 hectare property on which he raises mango and limes.  His wife is the owner of a 1 hectare property which is also used for farming.  Nazario works the fields and his wife cares for a number of animals near their home.  The have a number of sheep and two cows.

This is Nazario’s first loan from Edpyme Alternativa.  He plans to use the funds to purchase additional fertilizer for his farm and additional feed for the animals.  He dreams of expanding the family’s herd over time and purchasing additional land.  He hopes to be able to provide for his children education and provide them with more opportunities than he and his wife have had.

loans.use: Purchase additional fertilizer for his farm and additional feed for the animals

loans.name: Yanina Marleni

texts.es:
Yanina es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Triunfadoras” ubicado en el distrito de Cabanilla,  provincia de Lampa y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, de estado civil  conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, la señora  estudió educación secundaria.

Yanina viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año, el primer préstamo solicitado fue S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de su negocio venta de abarrotes.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio.

Su sueño es que su negocio crezca. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las charlas y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Yanina is a member of the communal bank “Mujeres Triunfadoras” located in the Cabanilla district in Lampa province in the department of Puno.  She is 35 years old, married, and has 2 children.  Yanina has a high school education.

Yanina has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for a year.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles, and she used the loan to increase her working capital in her business selling groceries.

Now she will request a new loan of 1,500 Peruvian soles which she will invest in the purchase of merchandise for her business.

Her dream is to grow her business.  What she like most about her communal bank are the chats she has with the members and the interest that she earns on her savings.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business selling groceries

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
The young woman in the photograph is Ly S., age 31, who lives in the province of Kompong Cham, the best territory for farming. 

Ly S. is a married woman who is devoted to her three young children, who attend school and depend on her care. Her husband also helps her in the same business. 

Ly S. owns a big farm that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows various crops on it. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. 

She planted rice and vegetable crops over two months ago, but her crops are not growing well because of their farm is outside of a watering system. So, Ly S. would like a loan to buy a pumping machine for irrigation, and the rest of the funds to purchase a sack of fertilizer for her vegetables.

loans.use: To buy a pump for irrigation.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty L. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Resty is separated from her spouse and has 3 school-aged children. 

To make a living, Resty owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing, shoes, shades & fashion pins in the local community. She is also engaging in making and selling souvenirs made from shells. Resty has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Resty joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Resty has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Resty is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used for additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Resty from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy inventory & use as working capital

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
Yovana es socia del  Banco Comunal “Bartolina Sisa” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de EL Collao, Departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil soltera y con grado de instrucción de secundaria incompleta.
Yovana tiene su negocio de venta de abarrotes, los productos son comprados desde Desaguadero y entregados por mayor en Puno. Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace seis meses, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le permitió comprar algunos productos de menor precio. 
La señora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 1200.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para incrementar el capital de su negocio. 
Su sueño es progresar en su negocio. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Yovana is a member of the communal bank "Bartolina Sisa," located in the Llave district of El Collao province in the department of Puno.  She is 25 years old, married, and has completed only part of a high school education. 

Yovana has a business selling groceries, products that she buys from Desaguadero and delivers at wholesale to Puno.  She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for 6 months.  The first loan she requested was for 300 Peruvian soles, which she used to buy some products at a lower price.

She is requesting a new loan of 1,200 Peruvian soles that she will use to increase the working capital in her business.  

Her dream is to make progress with her business.  What she likes about her communal bank are the easy payment terms on the loans.

loans.use: to increase the working capital of her business

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un C., 31, is a farmer who lives in Kompong Cham Province. Un C. earns about $2.5 per day.  In addition, she raises a few pigs in a stall at her home. 

Un C. is married to SokVeng, age 34, who assists her in the business. The couple has been married for years, and they have three children. All of them are single and are attending school. 

With growing family expenses, Un C. needs to increase her income. Un C. requests a loan of $600 to purchase small pigs to raise, and the remaining funds to buy additional feed. By using this loan she will get more profit and be able to support her family effectively. 

Un C. was busy when the photo was taken, so her husband is shown instead.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and animal feed

loans.name: 16.04.01 Dong Hai Group

texts.en:
Lien L. T. (33) is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Lien is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 01- Dong Hai (16.04.01 Dong Hai).

Lien is widowed and has 4 adult children.  To making a living, Lien owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling breakfast food that includes pork and noodles in the local community.  Lien has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2006, Lien joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  

Lien has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3079800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6000000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Lien from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Lien plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the other borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. T. Xuan (22) is a 47 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


2.  N. T. Van (4) is a 35 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business.


3.  N. T. Thinh (8) is a 52 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  L. T. Huong (32) is a 45 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


5.  L. T. Tuoi (6) is a 42 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


6.  T. T. Quan (15) is a 42 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


7.  N. T. Thoa (21) is a 41 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


8.  T. T. Tam (17) is a 46 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a butcher shop.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Lien L. T. (33) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Lien là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 9 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 01- Dong Hai (16.04.01 Dong Hai).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ thịt heo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Lien thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Lien kiếm được khoảng 3000000 VND.  Vào 2006, Lien đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Lien đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. T. Xuan (22) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


2.  N. T. Van (4) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


3.  N. T. Thinh (8) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

5.  L. T. Tuoi (6) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


6.  T. T. Quan (15) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


7.  N. T. Thoa (21) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


8.  T. T. Tam (17) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng thịt.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Yovana Margarita

texts.es:
Yovana es socia del  Banco Comunal “Bartolina Sisa” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de EL Collao, Departamento de Puno, tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con un hijo y tiene grado de instrucción superior completa.
La señora tiene su negocio de venta de abarrotes, producto que es traído desde Desaguadero y entregado en la ciudad de Puno. Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cuatro años, el primer préstamo solicitado que fue de S/.300. 00 nuevos soles, el cual lo utilizo para incrementar  el capital  de su negocio. 
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitira comprar mercadería para su negocio. Su sueño es tener un local para su negocio y distribuir al por mayor. Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal son todas las actividades que se realiza en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Yovana is a member of the communal bank “Bartolina Sisa,” located in the Llave district of El Collao province in the department of Puno. She is 27 years old, married, and has one child. She has a college education.

Yovana has a business selling groceries, products that she brings from Desaguadero and delivers in the city of Puno.  She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for 4 years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles, which she used to increase the working capital in her business.

Now she requests a new loan of 1,500 Peruvian soles, which will allow her to buy merchandise for her business.  Her dream is to have a place for her business, and to distribute at wholesale.  What she likes about her communal bank are all of the activities that they do in the meetings.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Byambasuren A. is a 48-year-old woman who lives with her husband and four children in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. Her oldest son works for the security agency, her second oldest son is a plumber, and her youngest son is disabled and studies at a special school. Her daughter works as a server in a cafe.

Byambasuren operates a small food shop next to the local school. She started her food-trading business in 2003 and has gained significant experience since then. For the future, she plans to buy a plot of land where she can build a house for her family and operate her shop next to her home. Byambasuren is a modest person; she says, "I am planning to start building a wooden house." She is requesting a loan of 400,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase more food products to sell in her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: 16-04-02 Dong Hai Group

texts.en:
N. T. Ky (34) is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Ky is the group leader of a 6-member group loan by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW).  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 02-Dong Hai (16-04-02 Dong Hai).

Ky is married and has 4 adult children.  To make a living, Ky operates a family member's fishing business.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling river-caught fish in the local community.  Ky has been engaged in this business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ky joined FPW to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ky has successfully repaid a previous FPW loan of 3,079,800 VND.  This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.  Ky is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will also be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.  This will be her fifth loan from FPW.  Ky plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  N. T. Sam (22) is a 55-year-old woman.  She is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock (agriculture sector).

2.  N. T. Dong (35) is a 60-year-old woman.  She is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock (agriculture sector).

3.  N. T. Tinh (36) is a 28-year-old woman.  She is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business (food sector).

4.  T. T. Thom (37) is a 35-year-old woman.  She is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store (retail sector)

5.  L. T. Ly (39) is a 41-year-old woman.  She is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business (food sector).

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for its field partner to allow it to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ky N. T. (34) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Ky là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02-Dong Hai (16-04-02 Dong Hai).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & bán các loại cá đánh bắt ở sông trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Ky thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 15 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Ky kiếm được khoảng 3000000 VND.  Vào 2007, Ky đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Ky đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua T.ết bị đánh cá bao gồm lưỡi câu & lưới.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

3.  N. T. Tinh (36) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.

4.  T. T. Thom (37) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

5.  L. T. Ly (39) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Pech C. is 56 years old and lives in the village of Roteang, in Kandal Province.  He and his wife, Vorn Lorn, are farmers who own a plot of land.  They cultivate vegetables and peanuts for a living.  They do not have enough money to support the farm, so Pech C. is asking for a loan to purchase a pump machine, fertilizer, and pesticides to cultivate rice.

The couple have three children: one is a teacher, one helps with the farm, and the youngest one is a student in the local village.  The photo shows Pech C. with his wife.

loans.use: To purchase a water machine, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Zayda Kattia

texts.es:
Zayda es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas Valientes” ubicado en el distrito de Azángaro,  provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 24 años de edad, de estado civil  soltera y con 01 hijo, la señorita realizó estudios de educación superior.

Zayda viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 03 años, el primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar el capital de  su negocio de venta de carnes vacunos - porcinos.

Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en su mercadería para su negocio.

Su es tener un carro, casa propia y poner una farmacia.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad, la solidaridad y el intercambio de palabras entre las socias.
texts.en:
Zayda is a member of the comunal bank, “Azangarinas Valientes,” or ‘Courageous Azangarians,’ located in the Azangaro province of Azangaro, Puno department. She is 24 and single with one son. She completed higher education. 

Zayda has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years. The first loan was for 500.00 nuevos soles, which she used to increase the capital in her pork selling business.

She is requesting a new loan of 500.00 nuevos soles, money that she will invest in merchandise for her business.

Her dream is to own a car and her own home and to open a pharmacy. 

What she likes best about the comunal bank are the punctuality, solidarity and interchange of ideas among the members.

loans.use: To invest in merchandise for her business

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Mrs. Soy S. is a 45-year-old married woman, and she lives in Pouthi Reamea village, Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. San John, are farming laborers. They receive a small income to support their family.  In there farming labor, they face a problem because they do not have pesticide spray to kill insect. Thus, Mrs. Soy S. would like to ask for a loan to buy a pesticide spray for her farming labor. In addition, she will use the rest of the loan to buy rice for food intake. This couple has three children: two are attending the local school, and the youngest one stays at home. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a pesticide spray for hire to villager.

loans.name: Serdamda

texts.en:
Serdamda D. is 43 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Hovd Province in Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. All four children attend a local secondary school. Serdamda and his wife operate a fuel-trading business in their town. He collects dried dung for fuel and rents a car to transport the dung to his town, where he sells it after packing it into bags.

Serdamda started his business in 2000 and has gained significant experience. He plans to save money for his daughter's future education costs. He says, "Our daughter is going to become a student in the next year; therefore, I am planning to save money from now on so that I can afford my daughter's tuition fees. I work hard to support my entire family." He is requesting a loan of 800,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase more coal and collect dung and wood to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more coal and collect dung and wood

loans.name: Vou

texts.en:
Vou V., age 60, is a widowed mother who operates a laundry business in front of her house in Battambang Province. She was married, but her husband died of senility and left her with seven children, six of whom have an occupation while the other one is single and studying in school. 

Vou V. has had experience in this sector for years. She always receives dirty clothes from villagers in and around her community because they have no time to wash their clothes by themselves. Vou V. normally earns an average of $2.50 per day to help cover the family’s daily living expenses. 

Vou V. is concerned that she faces difficulties with her traveling needs because she always pays a lot of money to a taxi driver when she and her family want to go anywhere. Therefore, she hopes to reduce the amount she spends on transportation by using her loan to purchase a used motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorbike

loans.name: Um Sokhay's Group

texts.en:
Eleven people have formed a group to request a loan. They are located in Angkrong village in Kandal Province. The group members selected Mrs. S. Um, a 40-year-old married woman, as the bank president for their group. Each member of the group will use his or her portion of the loan to support his or her individual purpose.

Mrs. S. Um earns her living by breeding pigs. Her husband, Mr. Chhoeng Sieb, who is 48, works as a rice miller; he owns a rice milling machine to support his business. They both work hard on their businesses to support their three children, two of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory and one of whom works locally as a beautician.

Mrs. S. Um is asking for a loan to buy beautician's supplies to support her child's current business.

loans.use: To buy beautician's supplies

loans.name: Dayanjalbuu

texts.en: Dayanjalbuu S. is a 55-year-old widow who lives with her daughter in a Mongolian nomadic dwelling called a ger in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband passed away, and her daughter, age 25, is doing her masters degree at the Mongolian National University. Dayanjalbuu operates a small shop in her yard next to the local school. She opened her shop, which is owned by her daughter, in 2009 and has built a stable operation. Her shop is a legal grocery store that is licensed by Expertise Agency. Her daily sales income is around 50,000 MNT. She buys her food products from big wholesale markets such as Orgil, Nomin and Harhorin. In addition, she also provides a rental facility, and two households rent her yard--these rental fees bring in 40,000 MNT per month. Moreover, Dayanjalbuu says, "I want my daughter to complete her postgraduate degree successfully and start to work in a big organization."  She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase two freezers and more food products for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase two freezers and more food products

loans.name: 18.04.63 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mai N. Thị is a 31-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Mai is the group leader of a eight-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 63-Quảng Hưng (18.04.63 Quang Hung).

Mai is single and does not have any children. To making a living, Mai owns and operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing women's tailoring services to local community members. Mai has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2100000 VND a month.

In 2010, Mai joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Mai is requesting her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan of 4248000 VND which will be used to purchase additional fabric and materials. Mai plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  N. Thị Xuân is a 41-year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  N. Thuỷ Chung is a 22-year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  L. Thị Thương is a 21-year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4.  N. Thị Lan is a 24-year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

5.  Lê Thị Lý is a 31-year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.

6.  N. Thị Dung is a 50-year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

7.  L. Thị Phượng is a 44-year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a butcher shop.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 63-Quảng Hưng (18.04.63Quang Hung).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ may mặc trang phục nữ giới cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Mai thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Mai kiếm được khoảng 2100000 VND.  Vào 2010, Mai đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Mai đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4,248,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. Thị Xuân (97) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  N. Thuỷ Chung (93) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  L. Thị Thương (96) là 21 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  N. Thị Lan (95) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  Lê Thị Lý (94) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


6.  N. Thị Dung (98) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


7.  L. Thị Phượng (99) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng T.t.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*L. ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional fabric and materials

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina  es socia del Banco Comunal “Ciudad Nueva” ubicado en el distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia D. El Collao, departamento D. Puno, tiene 76 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y con seis hijos, con grado D. instrucción primaria incompleta.
La actividad a la que se dedica es el engorD. D. toros. Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace tres años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual le sirvió para  incrementar el capital D. su negocio.
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo D. S/ 2000.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá incrementar el capital D. su negocio.
Lo único que desea es que sus hijos sigan adelante y estén bien. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Agustina is a member of the “Ciudad Nueva” Communal Bank which is located in the district of Pilcuyo, province of El Collao, department of Puno.  She is 76 years old, married, and has six children.  She did not complete primary school.

She is engaged in the business of raising bulls.  She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years.  Her first loan request was for S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, which helped her increase the working capital of her business. 

Now she is requesting a new loan for S/ 2000.00 nuevos soles which will allow her to increase her working capital once again.

All she desires is that her children keep well and continue getting ahead in life.  She is pleased with the punctual service that the Communal Bank provides.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Chhaem's Group

texts.en:
This village loan group consists of ten members. They live in Vihear village in Kandal province. Mrs. Chhaem N. is a 44-year-old married woman, selected as the village bank president by the members of this village. They will each use their portion of the loan to support his or her different purpose. 

Mrs. Chhaem N. raises chickens to earn a little income to support her family. However, she lacks enough money to maintain this business. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy food and to build a chicken house for her chickens. Her husband, Mr. Bith Vann, 48, works as a laborer and also helps in his wife's current business. 

This couple has seven children: three are seamstresses, three are attending the local school and the last one is four years old. 

On debursement day, Mrs. Chhaem N. did not come to take the loan but her husband did. Thus, Mr. Bith Vann is present in the picture instead of his wife.

loans.use: To buy food and build a chicken house for her chickens.

loans.name: Loeb's Group

texts.en:
Ten people are coming together for this village loan. They are located in Vihear village in Kandal province. The village members selected Mrs. Loeb C., 39 years old, as the village bank president. Each member of the group will each use his or her portion of the loan to purchase equipment, supplies and other items to support his or her different purpose. 

Mrs. Loeb C. is a farmer who owns a plot of rice field to cultivate rice for a living. To support this farm, she would like to use a loan to buy fertilizer to cultivate rice. The rest of the loan she would like to use to repair her chicken house. Her husband, Mr. Soem Chann, 42, works as motorbike taxi driver.
They have three children who are students in the local school and also support their parents' businesses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
Albina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Mensajeras” ubicado en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia San Román, departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y con 02 hijos, la señora realizo estudios de educación  primaria.

Albina viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 01 año,  nos cuenta que su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar el capital de su negocio de fabricación de prendas de vestir y tejidos.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero con el que comprará materiales para la confección de ropas para niños y producción de tejidos.
	
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y educar a sus hijos.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las reuniones, charlas y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Albina is a member of the communal bank, “Las Mensejaras,” or ‘The Messengers,’ located in the Juliaca District of the San Román province, Puno department. She is 34, in a common law marriage and has two children. She completed elementary school.

Albina has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for one year. She tells us that her first loan was for 500.00 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency], which she used to increase the capital for her business of weaving and making clothing.

Albina requests a new loan for 800.00 nuevos soles which she will use to purchase material for making children’s clothing and weaving. 

Her dream is to improve her business and educate her children. 

What she likes best about her comunal bank are the meetings, the talks, and what she earns in savings.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the production of clothing and weaving

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas de Rio Blanco” ubicado en el distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil casada y con cinco hijos, tiene grado de instrucción de educación primaria completa.
La señora, se dedica al engorde de ganado vacuno específicamente toros. Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco años, el primer préstamo recibido fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual le permito incrementar el capital de su negocio. 
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 3000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio.
Su sueño es  progresar en su negocio.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Andrea is a member of the “Brisas de Rio Blanco” Communal Bank which is located in the district of Pilcuyo, province of El Collao, department of Puno.  She is 48 years old and married with five children.  She has completed a primary school level of education.

Andrea is in the business of raising cattle, specifically bulls.  She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for five years.  The first loan she received was for S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, which allowed her to increase the working capital of her business.  

Now she is requesting a new loan for S/ 3000.00 nuevos soles which she will invest in her business.

Her dream is to advance her business.
She is please with the punctual service that the Communal Bank provides.

loans.use: To invest in her cattle (bull) raising business

loans.name: Lat's Group

texts.en:
The village loan consists of nine people, located in Vihear village in Kandal province. This village selected Mrs. Lat S., a 50-year-old married woman, as the village bank president. With the loans, they hope to increase their income to improve their family's living situation. 

Mrs. Lat S. is a farmer who owns a plot of rice field to cultivate for a living. Her husband, Mr. Muong Mut, 49, works as a fisherman. His fishing business needs some supplies, but they lack the money to buy them. So Mrs. Lat S. would like to use a loan to buy fishnets for her husband's fishing business. 

They have four children: two are seamstresses in the garment factory, and two are students in the local school and also help in their parents’ businesses.

loans.use: To buy fishnets for her husband's fishing business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites S. is from the village of Cataggaman Viejo, Tuguegarao city. She is 34 years old. Marites is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns and operates a transportation business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport services in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for this activity.

Marites joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP that will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marites from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

Patricia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

Patricia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Patricia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha R. is from the village of Brgy. Bonfal West, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 47 years old. Editha is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Editha owns and operates a business venture running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Editha has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Editha joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Editha from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina has a mixed farm on the outskirts of Kisii town in western Kenya. She has been in the farming business for fifteen years now. Her mixed farm produces sugarcane, maize, beans and milk which are all sold locally. She also owns a retail textile business in the same location. She is pictured here outside her retail shop. 

Robina is 34 years old. She is married and has six children who are between the ages of 10 and 22. Three of the children are currently attending school.

She has requested this loan of 50,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to start a cereals business. She says that this venture will help her realize more income which will help her pay school fees for her children and improve the livelihood of her family. 

She says that her biggest challenge in farming has been unpredictable weather conditions like drought and hailstones which affect her crop production and income. In the future, she would like to acquire more loans that will help her expand her farming and textile businesses.

loans.use: To start a cereals business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: A. Dorothy, a hardworking 40-year-old, has been operating a retail shop in Kyakatara- Kyenjojo for the last 12 years. It is a business which has been beneficial to her and her family in many ways, principally through improved welfare and better education for her 3 children. Dorothy began the business with funds from her first business - tea selling. The business generates 500,000 UGX monthly for her. Dorothy is married and she plans to use this loan to buy more retail merchandise for resale at her shop.

loans.use: to purchase more retail merchandise for resale

loans.name: Augustino

texts.en:
Forty-two-year-old Augustino M. is the married father of six children who are now between the ages of 9 months and 18 years. Five of the children are currently attending school. He is a farmer from the town of Kisii in western Kenya. He has been in the farming business for over twenty years. He has employed two casual laborers from his community. His farm produces tea, milk, vegetables, maize, beans, millet and bananas, which he sells through Kenya Tea Development Authority and the local market. He also operates a business in the same location of selling and repairing pumps. 

He has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 40,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children and improve the livelihood of his family. He also says that this dairy cow will improve his asset base and he will be able use it as collateral to secure other loans. His major challenges have been poor timing, which sometimes makes him vulnerable to the laws of supply and demand, and bad debtors, which affect his businesses. In the future, he plans to lease land to practice horticultural farming on a large scale. He also plans to purchase a posho mill (used for grinding maize into flour) in the future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie B. is very happy and feels very excited about the support that she received from Kiva lenders for her previous loan. She prays that they all will be blessed. She has a good relationship with the institution.

Now, Melanie is requesting another Kiva loan to continue her buy-and-sell secondhand appliances business. She has been able to improve her business due to her access to bigger loans from Kiva supporters.

She discovered the huge impact the loan has made on her family as, with the additional income, she was able to afford to buy desired needs and ensure prompt weekly payment of her obligation to ASHI. She is also happy because she is able to eat well and help her husband to meet the needs of the family. 

Melanie hopes that their business will continue to succeed because this has been their life, providing for their family for more than eleven years now. They love what they do.

Melanie’s business has been very helpful in achieving her dreams for her children. For her, it is joy to see fulfillment in her business and family and, with her six children growing up, she will want to see them having the best in life someday.

She prays that her business will continue to succeed so that she will be able to send all of her children to school until they complete college. She promises ASHI that she will work hard so that the chances that they give her will never be wasted.

loans.use: to support her secondhand appliances business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is requesting a loan of 80,000 KES to buy stock items such as bales of flour, rice, sugar and cooking fat, among other products. He operates a retail shop in Nairobi where he sells foodstuff and household items. His clients are mainly middle class earners in his neighborhood. John is married and he is the father to three who are in school. 

He describes himself as ambitious and persevering and hopes to be a major distributor of foodstuff in the future, with a desire of owning a wholesale shop in five years. John also sells kerosene and does photography for extra income. 

Faulu Kenya has provided him with relevant financial solutions to help him grow from a mere photographer to owning a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy stock items such as bales of flour, rice, sugar and cooking fat, among other products

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine L. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 28 years old. Christine is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling a variety of fish like sardines, solib, kutob, kabalyas, kugita and kubotan in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Christine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. She has been in the farming business for seventeen years and employs five farmhands. Her mixed farm produces maize, beans, millet, kale and milk, which she sells locally. She also operates a bar and a hotel in the same location. She is pictured here outside her business premises.

Mary is 41 years old. She is married with four school-aged children who all attend school.

She has a good record with Juhudi Kilimo after she successfully repaid her previous loan of 50,000 KES. She has requested this loan of 90,000 KES to continue to farm maize, beans, millet and vegetables. The extra income from this loan will help her pay school fees for her children and improve their livelihood. Her biggest challenge has been unreliable laborers, which affects her business performance.

loans.use: To continue farming maize, beans, millet and vegetables.

loans.name: Aurora's Group

texts.en:
Aurora B. is from the village of Anquiray, Amulung, Cagayan. She is 45 years old. Aurora is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Aurora is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Aurora owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Aurora has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Aurora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aurora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. Aurora is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand the product offering. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Aurora from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Yankasu

texts.en:
Yankasu K. is 20 years old and a livestock trader. He is married to Nempuris, who is also 20 years old and a farmer. Together they have two children, aged 6 and 2 years. He lives at Bissil in Kajiado and sells his livestock in the nearby markets. 

Bissil is a very busy market with a large population, so Yankasu’s livestock are bought at good prices. He then uses the profit to take care of his family and save for his children’s education.

Yankasu has been running his livestock trading business for 10 years and his monthly profit is KES 30000. He learned about Kadet Ltd. in a Kadet business awareness meeting conducted in the Bissil market.

Yankasu intends to use his loan to buy livestock for trading. If the loan boosts the business, he aims to start transporting his livestock to the Kenya Meat Commission, which will give him more profit. Yankasu is hardworking and dreams of becoming a big business man.

loans.use: To buy livestock for sale
