loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux, dans le quartier Dougounina de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali) Elles se sont connues à travers des relations de mariage et de commerce. 
Après avoir correctement remboursés, les quatre prêts précédents, ce groupe est à son cinquième et MAYON D. compte utiliser le sien pour acheter, des bassines de savons traditionnels appelé ‘’Gabacourouni’’ auprès des forains venant des grandes villes telles Sikasso et Bamako. Elle effectue sa vente en détail, au comptant et à crédit dans les foires de différents villages environnants Bougouni et à domicile à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt MAYON D. compte obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de 105.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisé dans les activités et l’autre partie dans les dépenses de la famille
texts.en:
The members of Benkadi Group ("Harmony") are married women. On average, they are 37 years old and have four children. They live in large traditional families with their brothers, sisters, co-wives, children and husbands. They live in the neighborhood of Dougounina of the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They have known each other through ties of kinship and business.

After having properly repaid its four previous loans, the group applies now for its fifth loan. Mayon Diakité wants to use her share of the loan to buy bowlfuls of traditional soap called "Gabacourouni" from traveling merchants coming from large cities such as Sikasso and Bamako. She retails the soap for cash or credit at the markets in the villages of the Bougouni area, as well as from her home. Her clientele is made up of men and women.

Thanks to this loan, Mayon Diakité expects to make a monthly profit of 105,000 CFA francs. She will invest it partly in her business and spend it partly on household needs.

loans.use: To buy traditional soap

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe BADEGNA de l’association SIGUIDIA sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et de 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies  dans le quartier Massabla-coura de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues  à travers des relations de voisinage et de  commerce. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SALI S., qui est un des membres du groupe, compte acheter, des chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe auprès des paysans agréés des villages environnants de Bougouni. SALI effectue sa vente en détail, au comptant et à crédit dans le quartier, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt SALI compte obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de 95.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisé dans l’activité et l’autre partie dans les dépendes de la famille.
texts.en:
The women of Badegna Group belonging to Siguidia Association are all married. On average, they are 30 years old and have three children. They live in large traditional families in the neighborhood of Massabla-Coura of the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They have known each other through ties of neighborhood and business.

In order to satisfy their ever increasing and demanding clientele, they decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their sixth group loan, after having properly repaid all their previous loans. Sali Sidibé, one of the group's members, wants to use her new loan to buy several cartloads of firewood from licensed farmers in the villages around Bougouni. Sali retails for cash or credit in her neighborhood to a clientele made up of men and women.

Thanks to this loan, Sali expects to make a monthly profit of 95,000 CFA francs. She will invest it partly in her business and spend it partly on household expenses.

loans.use: To buy firewood

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ekua Agyeiwaa Hagah

texts.en: Ekua Agyeiwaa Hagah O. smokes fish at Abura.  She also fries fish for sale. She has been through senior high school. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to fry for sale. She hopes to reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: buy more fresh fish to fry for sale

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva N. lives in the Lungujja Kitunzi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (sisters).  Eva has a business selling second hand clothes.  She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.  

Eva sells her products at the retail market.  Eva has requested a loan of 1,600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand clothes.   She also generates additional income through tailoring.  The main business challenges for Eva include the transport and ever increasing prices of clothes.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing second hand clothes.  Eva lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
C. Nguyễn Thị (20201030013) is a 54 year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has adult aged children.  C. owns and operates a restaurant business, and the primary source of income comes from serving dinner foods to customers in the local community.  C. has been in this business for over 22 years, and she earns approximately 3.900.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, C. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services, to help improve her living situation, and to give her the ability to engage in business activities.  C. successfully repaid a previous loan of 7.392.000 VND from SEDA, which was used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant.  C. is requesting a new loan of 8.736.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital.  This will be her 5th loan from SEDA, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


C. Nguyễn Thị (20201030013) là 54 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 54 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, C. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh nhà hàng.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ phục vụ thức ăn tối cho khách hàng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  C. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 22 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, C. kiếm được khoảng 3.900.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, C. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  C. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thức ăn & đồ uống cho nhà hàng.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.736.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  C. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Sophia Efia Ntiwa

texts.en: Sophia Efia Ntiwa E. is a fishmonger at Abura. She is a widow and has four children. Sophia has been a fishmonger for five years. She ensures the well-being of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Joana Ekua Yama

texts.en: Joana Ekua Yama M. sells fried fish at Abura. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a cleaner. Joana has been selling fried fish for four years. She assists her husband in taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to fry for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further her children’s education.

loans.use: buy more fresh fish to fry for sale

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont toutes mariées et ont une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs , co-épouses, enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Massabla-coura de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Ces  femmes se sont connues par des relations de commerce, de parenté et de voisinage. 
Afin de satisfaire leurs clientèles en nette croissance, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de groupe et tous les cinq prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt ROKIA K., compte acheter, 3 tonnes de céréales (mil, fonio, arachides, niébé etc) auprès des producteurs des villages environnants. Elle effectue sa vente en détail et en gros, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile, dans le marché de Bougouni, aux consommateurs et revendeurs. 
Avec ce prêt ROKIA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 85.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisé dans les activités et l’autre partie dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The women of Djiguisseme Group are all married. On average, they are 41 years old and have five children.  They live in large traditional families with their brothers, sisters, co-wives, children and husbands. They live in the neighborhood of Massabla-Coura of the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They have known each other through business, family and neighborhood ties.

In order to satisfy their markedly increasing clientele, they decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their sixth group loan, after having properly repaid all their previous loans. Rokia Konaté will use her new loan to buy 3 tons of cereals (millet, fonio, groundnuts, cowpeas, etc.) from farmers in nearby villages. She sells her cereals retail and wholesale, for cash and credit, at her home and at the market in Bougouni to consumers and retailers.

Thanks to this loan, Rokia expects to make a monthly profit of 85,000 CFA francs. She will invest it partly in her business and spend it partly on family expenses.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Doris Ama

texts.en: Doris Ama D. sells smoked and fried fish at Abura. She is married and has three children. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to fry for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to purchase a shop.

loans.use: buy more fresh fish to fry for sale

loans.name: Kelegna Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe KELEGNA sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et de 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier Massabla-coura de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.) Ces femmes se sont connues par des relations de voisinage et de commerce. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles de plus en plus croissantes et exigeantes, elles ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe et tous les deux prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt KOUMBA D., compte acheter, des chargements de charrettes en charbon de bois auprès des paysans producteurs. Elle effectue sa vente en détail, au comptant et à crédit, au marché et à domicile, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisé dans l’activité et l’autre partie dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The women of the KELEGNA group are all married and are, on average, 26 years old with two children. They live in traditional large families in the neighborhood of Massabla-coura in the city of BOUGOUNI (third largest region in the republic of Mali). These women known each other through the community as well as business.

In order to better satisfy their customers whom are both growing in size and becoming more exacting in their demands, these women have decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are currently on their third group loan after having correctly reimbursed the previous two.
 
With this loan KOUMBA D. plans to purchase bulk quantities of wood charcoal from countryside producers. She then sells the charcoal both for cash as well as credit, in the markets and from her home, to both male and female customers. With this loan she hopes to make a monthly profit of 65,000 FCFA [approximately USD $ 136 ] to reinvest in her business as well as provide for her family.

loans.use: Purchasing wood charcoal

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
N. Nguyễn Thị (20201030014) is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. She is married and has 4 adult -aged children. N. owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling bicycles in the local community. N. has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,200,000 VND a month from it.

In 2007, N. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,496,000 VND from SEDA, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. N. is now requesting a new loan of 8,736,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by N. from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


N. Nguyễn Thị (20201030014) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 4 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, N. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán xe đạp trong cộng đồng địa phương.  N. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 12 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, N. kiếm được khoảng 4.200.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, N. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  N. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.736.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  N. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

loans.name: Joyce Naa Awoshi

texts.en: Joyce Naa Awoshi N. is divorced and has two children. She processes palm oil and soap for sale at Abura. Joyce uses her income to see to the well-being of the family. Joyce will use the loan to purchase more palm fruits to prepare oil and soap for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Joyce plans to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: purchase more palm fruits to prepare oil and soap for sale

loans.name: Dorothy Yaa Amoakawah

texts.en: Dorothy Yaa Amoakawah G. is married and has four children. She has been through senior high school. Dorothy is a dressmaker at Abura. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She wants the loan to buy more cloth and other materials to enable her to produce items in large quantities for sale. She plans to reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: buy more cloth and other materials

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
DANAYA est un regroupement de femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 30 ans, 3 enfants et vivant dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies, avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants, autres parents et époux, dans le quartier périphérique de Massabla-coura extension appelé Antennikoro  de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.) Ces femmes se sont connues par des relations de commerce et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses,  elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de groupe, après avoir correctement remboursés les trois précédents.
Avec ce prêt, MINATA S., compte acheter, des pagnes wax et des colis d’habits pour enfants à Bamako, qui  seront tous vendus  au comptant et à crédit en ambulant dans la ville et au marché de Bougouni, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000 FCFA  qui sera utilisé dans les activités et l’autre partie dans les frais d’éducation de leurs enfants.
texts.en: DANAYA is a group of married women who are 30 years old on average, have an average of 3 children and who live conjugally in large traditional families with their brothers, sisters, co-spouses, children, parents and spouses, in the outlying neighborhood of Massabla-coura called Antennikoro, which is an extension of the city of Bougouni (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  These women know one another through business relations and neighborhood ties.  In the interest of better satisfying their growing number of customers, they decided to join the credit program of the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution.  They are on their fourth group loan, after having fully paid back the last three.  With this loan, Minata S. expects to buy wax loincloths and parcels of clothing for the children of Bamako, which will all be sold for cash and credit, by travelling through the town or by selling at the Bougoni market to a customer base made up of men and women.  With this loan, she hopes to make a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, part of which she will use for her business and the rest for educational costs.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert O. is 23 years old and married to Pamela, who sells vegetables to support her family. They have two children, Patrick four years and Justa two years old.

Robert is in the transport business and owns a motorbike that he has been using for the past three years. His business has developed a large clientele, partly due to the fact that the area has transportation problems. Robert is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD in order to buy another motorbike and also employ one person to help him in the business.

His desire is to buy a Nissan minibus for his enterprise.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Obaa Yaa Agartha

texts.en: Obaa Yaa Agartha D. sells fried fish at Abura. She has received junior high education. She is divorced and has two children. She is responsible for the well-being of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to fry for sale. She hopes to invest her profit back into her business.

loans.use: buy more fresh fish to fry for sale

loans.name: Pima Group

texts.fr:
PIMA  est un regroupement de quatre femmes toutes mariées dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux. Elles ont   une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans et de 3 enfants et résident à Massabla-coura, préfecture de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).  Elles se sont connues par des relations de commerce. 
Dans l’intention d’acheter plus de produits, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe, le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé. 
Avec ce prêt AWA K., compte acheter des colis d’habits pour femmes, hommes et enfants auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue sa vente au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 95.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisé dans l’activité et l’autre partie dans les frais d’éducation de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
PIMA is a group of four women, all married and living conjugally in large traditional families with their brothers, sisters, co-spouses, children and spouses.  They are 25 years old on average, have an average of 3 children, and live in Massable-coura, a prefecture of Bougouni (the third administrative region of the  Republic of Mali).  They know one another through commercial ties.  With the intention of buying more products, they decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  They are on their second group loan, having paid back the last in full.  With this loan Awa K. expects to buy packets of clothing for women, men and children as well as maternity wear.  She will sell for cash and for credit to a customer base made up of both men and women.
With this loan she expects to make a monthly profit of 95,000 FCFA, a part of which she will use for her business and the rest for the educational costs of her children.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Janet Adjoa Mamfoah

texts.en: Janet Adjoa Mamfoah A. is a hairdresser at Abura. She is a single parent taking care of one child. Demand is increasing, and she is looking to expand her business. The loan will be used to make available hair products that are frequently requested by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop and to purchase an additional dryer.

loans.use: buy hair products that are frequently requested by her customers

loans.name: Patience Abena Kwato

texts.en: Patience Abena Kwato M. smokes fish at Abura for sale. Patience has been through junior high school. She is married and has two children. Her husband is an electrician. She assists her husband in the general welfare of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards acquiring a plot of land.

loans.use: buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem lives in the historic city of Pakistan called Lahore. She lives there with her family in an area named R-A Bazar for over 12 years.  She is 38 years old, is married to S. J. and has three daughters. All of her daughters attend school to get an education. Her husband is involved in a rent a bike business. He gives his bikes to people on rent and charges them on an hourly basis.   

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy another motorbike and use it for his business.   The additional bike will help his customers find a bike for their use, otherwise due to the limited numbers of bikes, he has been unable to fulfill the orders on time.  

Naseem is hopeful that this investment will bring more profits to her husband’s business and her family’s financial life will become easier.  She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application.   

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy another motor bike for the rent-a-bike business.

loans.name: Faustina Ekua Owusuwaa

texts.en:
Faustina Ekua Owusuwaa O. is divorced and has seven dependents. She has no educational background. She sells doughnuts and porridge at Abura, which she has been doing for the past five years. Faustina will add the loan to her initial capital so she can expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to further her dependents' education.

Faustina has in her hands samples of the way she bags the porridge for her customers.

loans.use: add the loan to her initial capital

loans.name: Veronica Abena Atta

texts.en: Veronica Abena Atta A. is into the sale of foodstuffs at Abura. She is married and lives together with her eight dependents. Her husband is a farmer. She has been trading in foodstuffs for four years. She assists her husband in educating, feeding, and clothing her children. Her loan will be used to buy more varieties of foodstuffs to meet the increasing demands of her customers. She hopes to reinvest her additional profit.

loans.use: buy more varieties of foodstuffs

loans.name: Constance Efia Antwi

texts.en: Constance Efia Antwi M. is divorced and has one child. She operates a bar where she sells soft drinks, bags of water and other items at Abura. Constance has been in this business for two years. She is asking to use the loan to expand her operations, thereby increasing her income. With the new profits from her expanded business, Constance plans to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: expand her operations, thereby increasing her income

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.en: Marguerite is 33 years old. She is married and has three children who are between five and thirteen years old. Two of her children go to school. She is married to a farmer.  Marguerite runs a retail shop and sells variety of items such as rice, sugar, salt and maize flour.  She has had this business for two years. Marguerite is requesting this loan to buy more rice, sugar, and maize flour to sell. The profit from this business will be used to buy a cow and build an extension to her business building.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana E. sells cosmetics at Abura. She has no formal educational background. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a driver. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more cosmetics for sale. She hopes to reinvest into her business by building a shop.

loans.use: buy more cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius has a mixed farm in Nkubu town, eastern Kenya that produces maize, beans and potatoes which he sells at the local market. He has been practicing mixed farming for 15 years and employs 5 farmhands. His major challenges have been unfavorable weather conditions especially drought which affects his crops and low product prices when there is a glut in the market.

He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to start a poultry project. The proceeds from this project will help him pay the school fees for his children and expand his poultry farming. In the future, he would like to do large scale poultry farming because the demand for eggs is high and the prices are favorable. 

Julius is 41 years old. He is married with 3 school-aged children who all attend school. He comments that the loans from Juhudi are really helping small-scale farmers expand and grow from subsistence farming to more intensive commercialized farming.

loans.use: To start a poultry project.

loans.name: Vivian Ama Kissewah

texts.en: Vivian Ama Kissewah D. sells cassava at Abura. She also sells roasted plantains. She has received junior high education. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a painter. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs and plantains to roast for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more foodstuffs and plantains to roast for sale

loans.name: Kahaso

texts.en:
Kahaso is a married woman with eight children, seven of whom attend school while one is still too young. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and school fees. 

She has operated a food stall business selling cooked rice, beans and fried potatoes. She sells from home, selling to her neighbours and passersby.  In addition she also sells charcoal, contributing to her other source of income.  Kahaso faces a major challenge of seasonality and competition in her business.  She hopes to  build her own house in the future. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase 10 trays of eggs for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase 10 trays of eggs for resale.

loans.name: Dina Adjoa Kumima

texts.en: Dina Adjoa Kumima M. is married and has three children. Dina is a hairdresser at Abura. Her husband is a tour guide at Kakum National Park in Cape Coast. Dina assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She is requesting the loan to purchase more hair products to use on her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Dina plans to build a shop.

loans.use: purchase more hair products to use on her customers

loans.name: Batchuluun

texts.en:
Batchuluun D. is 62 years old and lives with his wife in the Hovd province of Mongolia.  He and his wife live in their own house which was built from his business earnings. Batchuluun and his wife operate a grocery store in their yard. In 2006, he had built his own work place and opened his grocery shop in it. Since then, they have found success in a short period of time and have managed to increase their working capital.  

Over years of stable operation, he was able to build a house for his family. Batchuluun wants to continue to grow his business and increase his working capital. For the future, he plans to expand his grocery trading business. He is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan so that he can purchase a greater amount and variety of groceries for his food shop.

loans.use: To purchase a greater amount and variety of groceries.

loans.name: Esther Adjoa Amoatemah

texts.en: Esther Adjoa Amoatemah A. is divorced and has six dependents. She has been through senior high school.  She sells doughnuts and fried fish at Abura,which she has been doing for ten years now. Esther is asking to add the loan to her initial capital to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest.

loans.use: add the loan to her initial capital

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua M. is married to a farmer and has four children. Efua sells second-hand clothes at Abura. She has been selling second-hand clothes for twenty years. She assists her husband in feeding, clothing and educating her children. Efua will use the loan to purchase more second-hand clothes for sale. Efua plans to plough back into her business her new profits from her expanded operations.

loans.use: purchase more second-hand clothes for sale

loans.name: Janet Nana Ama

texts.en:
Janet Nana Ama A. is married and has eight dependents. She has junior high educational background. Janet is a palm oil extractor at Abura. Her husband is a driver. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Janet will use the loan to purchase more palm fruits to prepare oil for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Janet plans to buy a piece of land.

In this photo, Janet has two big barrels full of pounded palmfruits, ready to be processed into oil.

loans.use: purchase more palm fruits to prepare oil for sale

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Battsetseg S. is 29 years old and a single parent with three children.  She lives with her children and her mother in a winter house in her brother's yard in Harhorin, the ancient capital city of the Mongolian empire, . All three of her children attend a local secondary school while her mother is retired. 

Battsetseg operates a knitting and felt products making business in her town. She started her business in 2007 after purchasing a wool spinning machine. In addition, she started to make traditional boots for children to supplement her earnings.  She has received many orders for her new item.  She is a modest person and is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase materials and supplies to make traditional Mongolian boots.

loans.use: To purchase materials and supplies to make traditional Mongolian boots.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 44 years old. She is married and has five children who are between the ages of three and twelve years old.  Three of her children are enrolled in school.  Her husband has physical disabilities.  

Alphonsine has a retail shop and sells different products such as rice, sugar, maize flour, cooking oil and biscuits.  She has spent seven years in this business.  Alphonsine is requesting this loan to be able to increase her inventory.  With the profit from this business, she will pay school fees for her children and buy a forest which produces timber for sale. 

Her business is successful and it generated money that she used to construct a business building and installed electricity in it.  In the future, she would like to see her business generating more profits.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, maize flour and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Mary Adjoa

texts.en: Mary Adjoa A. is into the sale of plastic bowls in Abrafoa near Abura. She travels around her locality to sell the bowls. She is married and takes care of six dependants. Her husband is a blacksmith. She assists her husband in providing for the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more plastic bowls to expand her business. She hopes to reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: To buy more plastic bowls

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Bayarbold

texts.en:
Bayarbold Y. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Harhorin, the ancient Mongolian empire's capital.  He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife stays at home taking care of their two daughters.  

Bayarbold owns and operates his own wood product business in his home.  He started his business in 2000 based on his childhood talents and interest in crafts.  All of his products are made with great care and attention to detail which has earned him a reputation among his customers as a quality furniture maker.  

Bayarbold is a modest and hardworking man and plans to have his own work place in the near future. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of wood materials for his furniture making business.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of wood materials.

loans.name: Munhbat

texts.en:
Munhbat S. is 35 years old and lives with his wife and four children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia.  The family lives together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. All four of his children attend the local secondary school.  

Munhbat and his wife operate the family businesses.  They own three kind of businesses such as taxi service, pc game service provider center and a dairy products production to support their family.  Munhbat is a herder and raise his own herd of 250 livestock in his town.  He first started his business in 2006 by producing and selling a variety of dairy products and since 2007, he has been operating a taxi service using his own car.  

After years of successful operation on both businesses, he has expanded his business facility and started to manage a pc game center. Moreover, he also produces and sells ice cream in his home to supplement his family income. Munhbat is a very hardworking man and for the future, he says, "I plan to save more money in order to establish my own big dairy product production factory in the future."  He is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to repay his computer loan and decorate his work place.

loans.use: To repay for his computer loan.

loans.name: Kahaso

texts.en:
Kahaso is a married woman with seven children, six of whom attend school, while one is too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing. 

She operates a vegetables stall at the market, selling green vegetables and potatoes to her neighbours and passersby. Kahaso faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to improve her business and repair her house in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase more sacks of green vegetables and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of green vegetables and potatoes

loans.name: Bayarjargal

texts.en: Bayarjargal D. is a 22-year-old single parent, with a child who stays at home. She lives with her mother and child in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She started her own business in 2006 with the help of her mother, by cooking meals in her home and delivering them all over town, to markets and office buildings, to sell. She graduated from a training course as a beautician in 2009 and since then has been working as a beautician. In addition, she also started to operate a fruit retail trading business to supplement her earnings. Bayarjargal is a very hardworking and open-minded woman. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and establish her own wholesale trade center. She is requesting a 380,000 MNT loan in order to increase her working capital for her fruit retail trading business.

loans.use: To buy more fruit

loans.name: Gavaa

texts.en: Gavaa U. is 41 years old and lives with his wife and nine-year-old daughter in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His daughter attends a local secondary school. Gavaa operates a firewood and coal selling business in his town, with the help of his wife. He started his business in 2005 after working and living as a herder in the countryside till 2004. For the future, Gavaa says, "I would like to save more money in order to establish my own fuel trading market further." He is requesting a 450,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more wood

loans.name: Purvee

texts.en: Purvee J. is 51 years old and lives with her husband and two adult daughters in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her oldest daughter works as a cook in a local restaurant and has a monthly salary of 200,000 MNT, while her youngest daughter is a tax inspector, but is currently unemployed. Purvee and her husband operate a meat trading business in their town. She started her business in 2004, based on her previous work experience as a salesperson in a small store. Her business currently operates at a stable level and she continues to make progress. For the future, Purvee says, " I want to focus on continue to operate my business so that I can buy a cafe for my daughter." Purvee is requesting a 2,200,000 MNT loan for working capital for her meat trading business.

loans.use: To buy more meat

loans.name: Gulkaiyr Kuban Kyzy's Group

texts.en:
Gulkaiyr is 35 years old and married. Her husband works for the Ministry of Internal Affairs. The couple is raising a daughter who is a teenager and goes to school. 

In order to earn extra money to cover family expenses the Gulkaiyr started to breed cattle. Later Gulkaiyr’s brother became a family partner who helped operate the business. Out of profits the family has noticeably improved their financial position.

Now in order to obtain a horse for further fattening and resale Gulkaiyr hopes to obtain a loan. Then her plans including automobile buying. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a horse

loans.name: Tsetsgee

texts.en:
Tsetsgee S. is 39 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Bayanhongor Province in Central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. One of her children is a university student and a second attends a local secondary school. 

Tsetsgee currently operates three separate businesses in her town with the help of her husband. Their businesses include used shoe trading, a cafe and a taxi service. Tsetsgee manages the cafe and the second hand shoe trading business. Her husband is responsible for managing the taxi service. She started her cafe in 2007 and has built a stable operation. Since 2008, she has been selling a variety of second hand shoes imported from Germany and has built a stable operation except during the winter months. They have found success in all three ventures and have a strong customer base throughout their community.

 For the future, the couple is planning to continue growing all their businesses. Tsetsgee is a modest and hardworking woman. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of second hand shoes for her retail business.

loans.use: To purchase second hand shoes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more charcoal and water for resale

loans.name: Nazgul's Group

texts.en:
Nazgul M. is the wife of a farmer. The couple has 4 daughters, the elder two are institute of higher education students, and the younger two are school girls.

The parents, with the help of their diligent daughters, operate a business in cattle breeding. From the profits of 10 years of hard work,  they have managed to build a house and pay for their children’s study.

In order to increase their total income, the family members decided to fatten and resell more cattle, thus they are planning to obtain several farm animals for further breeding. For this plan to be come true, Nazgul is applying for a loan. She cherishes a dream to improve her family’s living conditions.
	

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 .

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase breeding cattle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy plantain, eddoes and cassava for resale

loans.name: Fadila

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 55 years old, married, and has two children. Three relatives live with her family.

In 2006 she opened a small food market in the rural area where she lives. She received a loan previously to expand her shop. She has an excellent reputation. 

Now she is applying for a second loan of US$ 2900 to renovate her premises. She is going to repaint the store and put in new floor. She aims to improve her family's quality of life and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: renovating her premises

loans.name: Syinat's Group

texts.en:
Syinat T. is a mature-aged woman. She and her spouse, who is already on a pension, have been bringing up their three children, the youngest of them is a student. 

Syinat makes her money by working as a school teacher.  Unfortunately her low salary can’t satisfy all life's necessities.  Her daughters are currently working in Russia, this way they support their parents financially. Additionally, Syinat together with her husband are engaged in cattle breeding.

The family aims to improve their living conditions.  For this aim to be achieved they want to increase cattle stock.  For this purpose, a loan needed to be obtained.

	--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 .

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase breeding cattle

loans.name: Hamziya

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 69 years old and she is a widow with no children.

She started her business in 1995 selling grains, tea, sugar, flour and other foodstuffs. She well known in her community and she has a reputation for being nice and trustworthy. This is her fourth loan.  

She applied for US$ 2400 to renovate her shop and extend it. She is planning to grow and expand her business so she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: renovating and extending her shop

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata D. est âgée de 49 ans,  mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle  avec son mari, ses enfants et plusieurs autres ménages, au quartier Pelengana sud  de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné  l’école pour se marier par volonté parentale, elle débuta tôt le petit commerce d’articles divers de toutes sortes. Elle mène cette activité depuis 15 ans  et jouit d’une grande réputation et notoriété. 
Dans  le dessein de renforcer son fonds de commerce afin de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle décida de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 54 mois. Après 3 prêts solidaires et 3 prêts individuels tous bien remboursés,  elle  est à son 4ème prêt individuel, qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 4 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe et 2 sacs de riz. Elle s’approvisionne  sur place. Madame Aminata D. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA, qui lui servira à rembourser son prêt et à participer à des événements sociaux.
texts.en: Mrs. Aminata D. is 49 years old, married and the mother of 8 children.  She lives in a traditional family with her husband, her children and several other household members, in the Pelengana neighborhood in the south of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  Having left school to get married at her parents’ wishes, she started her small business of diverse articles of all sorts early on.  She has run her business for 15 years and enjoys a great reputation and fame.  With the intention of strengthening her business funds in order to meet the demands of her customer base, she decided to join Soro Yiriwaso 54 months ago.  After three group loans and three individual loans, all fully paid back, she is on her fourth individual loan, which she expects to use to buy four cartloads of heating wood and two bags of rice.  She stocks up in town.  Mrs. Aminata D. sells for cash and for credit to a customer base made up of both men and women.  She expects to make a monthly profit off 40,000 FCFA, which will allow her to pay back her loan and to participate in social events.

loans.use: To buy various articles

loans.name: Assitan

texts.fr:
Madame Assitan Traoré est âgée de 32 ans,  mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle avec son mari, ses enfants et autres ménages au quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté  l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle commença très tôt le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait du poisson. Après plusieurs années passées à côté de cette dernière,  depuis maintenant 10 ans elle évolue seule en menant  la même activité, au marché château et jouit d’une grande clientèle. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de sa marchandise, qui est très prisée sur le marché « les capitaines de Niono »
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice, elle fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso,  elle est à son 1er  prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 12 paniers de poissons frais auprès des pêcheurs. Madame Assitan Traoré vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA, qui lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et à aider son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales.
Son ambition est de construire une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mrs. Assitan Traoré is 32 years old, married and mother to three children. She lives in a traditional family with her husband, children and other couples in the Hamdallaye district of Ségou (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region).

She did not go to school for social reasons and thus went into business at an early age with her mother, who sold fish. After several years at her mother's side, she began developing the same activity by herself. She has been doing this for ten years now at the Chateau market and has a large customer base. Her sales strength is due to the quality of her goods, which are very popular at the "Capitaines de Niono" market. With a view to increasing her business in order to make more profit, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso. She is on her first individual loan, with which she is planning to buy twelve baskets of fresh fish from fishermen. Mrs. Traoré sells for cash and on credit to a customer base made up of men and women. 

She is expecting to make a monthly profit of 75,000FCFA, which will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband to cover the family's expenses. Her ambition is to build a house for them to live in.

loans.use: To purchase fresh fish

loans.name: Harbiya

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 63 years old and a married women. She has four children and four relatives live with her family.

She started her business in 1980 and she works at her own house. She is a seamstress and she is well known where she lives and has an excellent reputation. 

She is requesting a loan of US$ 2700 to buy new sewing and embroidery machines in addition to a small generator. She is aiming that her business will grow bigger and be more advanced. This way she will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: buying new sewing and embroidery machines in addition to a small generator

loans.name: Fatoumata Bintou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata Bintou H. est âgée de 26 ans,  mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle  avec son mari, ses enfants et plusieurs ménages au 2ème quartier de la ville de Ségou  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné  l’école  en classe de 9ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien)  pour se marier par volonté parentale, elle débuta le petit commerce juste après son mariage. Elle mène depuis maintenant 7 ans cette activité de vente d’habits de tous genres et jouit d’une grande réputation et notoriété. 
Dans  le but d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 18 mois,  après 3 prêts solidaires   bien remboursés. Elle  est à son 1er  prêt individuel  qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 100 complets pour enfants. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako. 
Madame Fatoumata Bintou H. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée  de femmes majoritairement. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA, qui servira à rembourser son prêt et à aider son, mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales.  Son ambition est de donner plus d’élan à son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata Bintou H. is 26 years old, married and the mother of three. She lives in a traditional extended family with her husband, her children and several relatives in the second district of the town of Ségou (the fourth administrative district of Mali).

Having left school in the 9th year of general studies (in Mali’s educational system) in order to get married in accordance with her parents’ wishes, she started her business right after her marriage.  With 7 years of experience selling all types of clothing, she is well-known now and enjoys a good business reputation. In the goal of increasing her working capital so as to better meet customer demand, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso. She has been with Soro Yiriwaso for 18 month and obtained three solidarity loans, all well repaid. She is now on her first individual loan, which she plans to use for purchasing 100 infant’s outfits. She stocks up in Bamako. 

Mrs. Fatoumato Bintou H. sells for cash and on credit to a customer based composed mainly of women.
She plans to achieve a monthly income of 75,000 West African francs, which will be used to repay her loan and to help her husband with household expensive. She strives to reinvigorate her business.

loans.use: Purchasing children's clothing

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata Diakité est âgée de 49 ans,  mariée et mère de 4 enfants, elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle  au quartier Sokala de la ville de Ségou  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Secrétaire de Direction, parallèlement à cette profession, elle mène des activités commerciales. Elle a appris le commerce dès son jeune âge, auprès de ses parents qui étaient des commerçants. Fatoumata  commença son activité  par le commerce de céréales, par la suite la vente d’articles divers importés du Burkina Faso. En cette époque, elle était intermédiaire dans le circuit de la vente, elle prenait chez les grossistes pour les placer auprès de ses clients qui étaient généralement des collègues de services. 
Après son licenciement, pour ne pas rester inactive, elle continua mais en intensifiant la même activité. 
Dans  le but de satisfaire sa demande clientèle surtout pour les fêtes qui s’approchent (Tabaski, Noël et le Réveillon), elle décide de continuer avec Soro Yiriwaso en demandant un nouveau prêt. Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 42 mois, il  a déjà eu 3  prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels tous bien remboursés. 
Elle  est à son 3ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 4 cartons de parfums et 15 chemises. Elle s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso et
Effectue sa vente au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA, qui lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et à  aider son mari. Son ambition est de développer son commerce.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata Diakité is 49 years old, married and the mother of four. She lives in a traditional family in the Sokala district in the town of Ségou (the fourth administrative district of Mali).  In addition to being an administrative secretary, she is also a merchant. She has learned this trade very early on from her parents who were merchants as well. She has started her business by selling cereals, and later also various other items imported from Burkina Faso. Back then, she was an intermediary in the selling chain; she would purchase goods from wholesaler and sell them to her customers, mostly her co-workers. After she lost her job, in order to avoid being idle, she continued with her business, concentrating on it more fully.

In order to be able to better meet customer demand, especially in view of approaching holidays: Tabaski (Eid), Christmas and New Year’s Eve, she decided to continue collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso and request another loan. She has been with Soro Yiriwaso for 42 months. She already had three solidarity loans and two individual loans, all duly repaid. She is now on her third individual loan, which she plans to use for purchasing four boxes of perfumes and 15 shirts. She stocks up in Burkina Faso and sells for cash and on credit to a customer base composed of both men and women.  She plans to achieve a monthly income of 40,000 West African Francs, which will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband. Her goal is to expand her business further.

loans.use: Purchasing various items

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Madame Mariam Samaké est âgée de 44 ans,  mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille nucléaire  avec son mari et  ses enfants   au quartier Sido Sonicoura de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné  l’école pour  se marier par volonté parentale, elle débuta très tôt  le petit commerce. Elle mène des activités d’achat et de vente de condiments alimentaires depuis 19 ans  et jouit d’une grande réputation et notoriété. Elle vend  au marché château, sa place est facile d’accès, elle est à côté des vendeurs de poulets. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de ses articles et également à la bonne conservation de ses produits.
Dans le but d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 66 mois, a déjà eu 5 prêts solidaires et 3 prêts individuels qui ont tous été remboursés sans aucune difficulté. Elle est à son 4ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter 150kg de beurre de karité, 3 bidons d’huile alimentaire et 1 sac d’oignon. Elle s’approvisionne sur place auprès des grossistes. Madame  Mariam Samaké  vend au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle essentiellement constituée de femmes.
Avec ce prêt, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000  FCFA, ce dernier lui permettra de rembourser son prêt de participer à des événements sociaux (mariage, baptême etc.).
Son ambition est de faire l’aviculture.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariam Samaké is 44 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She lives in a nuclear family with her husband and their children in the neighborhood of Sido Sonicoura, in Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali).

Having dropped out of school to get married at her parents’ request, she started small trade activities early on. She has been buying and selling food condiments for 19 years and enjoys a great reputation. She sells her merchandise at the “Château” market. Her booth, next to the chicken sellers, is easily accessible. Her strength is in the quality and preservation of her products.

In order to increase her profits, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso. She has been a member of the micro-finance institution for 66 months, and has already benefited from five group loans and three individual loans, all fully repaid. 

She is seeking a forth individual loan, which she intends to use to buy 150 kg of shea butter, 3 cans of cooking oil, and a bag of onions. She buys locally from wholesalers, and sells for cash and credit to a clientele consisting primarily of women.

With this loan, she expects to make a monthly profit of 45,000FCFA. This will allow her to repay the loan and take part in social events (weddings, baptisms, etc.). Her goal is to engage in poultry farming.

loans.use: To purchase condiments

loans.name: Kasem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old and a married man. He lives with five members of his family.

He has been a barber since 2009 and his shop is rented. He is well known in his community and has a good reputation.

He is applying for a US$ 1200 loan to extend his shop and make it spacious. He aims that this loan will help him to grow his business.

loans.use: extending his shop

loans.name: Lala

texts.ru:
Lala G. 52 qoda. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom , ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli, seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste s semyoy kotoraya sostoit iz shesti chelovek.

Lala uje 5 let zanimayetsya etim biznessom, ranshe ona imela maqazin qde prodovala odejdu , no potom ona u svoyey sestri nauchilas shit i reshila stat partnixoy tak kak u neyo yest xorosheya fantaziya ona shyet odejdu s interesnim dizaynom. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit shveynuyu mashinu tak kak yeyo mashina isportilas.
texts.en: Lala G. is 52 years old.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is refugee from Fuzuli and now lives in the Absheron region with her family.  Lala has been involved in this business for 5 years.  Previously, she owned a store, where she sold clothing.  Then she learned how to sew from her sister and because Lala has a good imagination, she makes clothing with interesting designs.  Currently, she needs 2000 AZN in order to purchase a new sewing machine because her current sewing machine broke.

loans.use: Purchase of a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more oil, onions, seasoning, pepper, salt, rice, etc. for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more red oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more body cream, spray, slippers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice, onions, pepper, salt, seasoning, oil, beans etc.

loans.name: Sakhavat

texts.ru:
Sakhavat S. 42 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 4 detey, doch kotorory 20 let ona uchitsya v universitete , doch kotorory 19 let ona toje uchitsya v universitete i xodit na tanci, doch 13 le uchitsya v shkole, i sin kotoromu 3 qoda.

Sakhavat yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Kalbadjar, seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste s semyoy. Sakhavat uje 2 qoda imeyet svayo kafe. Eto uje vtoroya ssuda perviy raz on bral 1000$ i ochen blagodaren lenderam za pomosh. Uje 2 qoda kak on pomenyal svoy bizness i poetomu on seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit stoli i stulya dlya razvitiya svoyeqo kafe.

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/2755
texts.en: Sakhavat S. is 42 years old.  He is married and has 4 children: a 20-year-old daughter, who attends a university, a 19-year-old daughter, who also attends a university and takes dance lessons, a 13-year-old daughter, who goes to school, and a 3-year-old son.  Sakhavat is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Kalbadjar and now lives in the Absheron district with his family.  Sakhavat has owned a cafe for 2 years.  This is his second loan.  He first borrowed $1000 and is very grateful to the lenders for help.  Two years have passed since Sakhavat changed his business and that is why he now needs 2000 AZN in order to buy tables and chairs for improving his cafe.

loans.use: Purchase of tables and chairs for his cafe

loans.name: Reginah Karimi

texts.en:
Reginah is 29 years old and married to Samuel Muendu. Together they have one child, age 4. 

This will be Reginah's first loan from KADET, and she intends to use it to grow her beauty salon, purchase a blow dryer, and add stock for the store.

She intends to use the profits to employ an extra staff member and educate her child. In the future, she hopes to run a more elegant salon and create a college for hairdressers.

loans.use: To buy a blow dryer and beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more crushed rocks.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a retail shop, whereby she sells sugar, rice and cereals from her home to her neighbours and passers-by. Flora faces a major challenge of delayed payments by creditors who purchase goods on credit. She hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase sugar, rice and cereals for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice and cereals for resale.

loans.name: Jane Rose

texts.en:
Jane is a 28-year old woman with one child, Safeway Wanja, age 3.

She has been running a tailoring business for five years. With anticipated profits from the growth of the business, Jane hopes to employ one person as staff, and improve on efficiency and timely delivery to customers. 

This is her first loan from KADET and she intends to buy a sewing machine.  In the future, Jane hopes to open a tailoring school and tailoring outlets in the city center.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy used clothes for resale

loans.name: Nikolai

texts.en:
Nikolai is married with two grown children. He is a farmer from the small town of Vodyanoye, in eastern Ukraine. He grows early spring vegetables, i.e. tomatoes, radish, etc. Nikolai owns 5 big greenhouses and a separate one for seedlings. Three of them have heating systems. He tried his luck in this business 15 years ago. 

Currently, Nikolai has already invested about 100,000 Grivnyas into his flourishing farming business. He spends about 20,000-22,000 Grivnyas on seeds and polyethylene film every year.  

Nikolai is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to install heating units in 2 of his six greenhouses. He is hoping to plant and grow 9,000 tall-grown tomatoes. Nikolai has witnessed an obvious advantage of heating systems in his greenhouses: tomatoes ripen much faster and rot less.  He is hoping to continue investing in his business which has very good potential in this highly agricultural region of Ukraine.

loans.use: To install heating systems in 2 greenhouses

loans.name: Lubomyr

texts.en:
Lubomyr is married with three children. He and his family live in Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine. Lubomyr breeds pigs. He then butchers them and sells the fresh meat in the local grocery market. Lubomyr’s product is in constant demand: local meat vendors trust him and come to him for fresh supplies of pork. 

Lubomyr started his venture 7 years ago. He had some savings and invested them in purchasing an abandoned stable. Presently, Lubomyr has 1 hired employee and 2 freelancers who come in when additional help is needed. Lubomyr receives about 8,000 Grivnyas in income each month. 

Lubomyr is seeking a loan of 7,500 Grivnyas to buy additional swine stock. The business is the main source of income for him and his family. One of Lubomyr’s goals is to generate additional income and savings to be able to buy his own house. With a family of five it’s getting harder and harder to live in a rented house. Lubomyr is willing to work extra hard to provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: To buy additional swine stock

loans.name: Beatrice Akello

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 48 year-old woman living in Dandora. She has run her general store for ten years.

She intends to use the loan to buy more stock, including bananas, avocado, vegetables, and for transport. She will sell these goods at a retail market and sell her supplies to fruit vendors at Muthurwa Market. 

She was introduced to KADET through a friend. Beatrice's dream is to own a store in the heart of Gikomba Market.

loans.use: To buy fruits & vegetables, and transport them to market

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more posters for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Seyidaga

texts.ru:
Seyidaga A. 27 let. On ne jenat i uje qod kak vmeste s semyoy oni pereyaxali v Absehron region.
Seyidaga uje qod kak rabotayet taksistom, iz za toqo chto oni pereyexali on bil vinujden pomenyat svoyu rabotu , no po slovam Seyidaga on etu novuyu rabotu taksista polubil yeshe bolshe chem staruyu rabotu.

Eto uje vtoroya ssuda Seyidagi , v perviy raz on bral 725$ on ochen blagodaren lenderam za ssudu. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya svoyeqo taksi.


http://partners.kiva.org/lend/35749
texts.en: Seyidaga A. is 27 years old.  He is not married and moved to the Absheron region together with his family one year ago.  Seyidaga has been working as a taxi driver for one year.  Due to the move, he had to change jobs, but, according to his own words, Sayidaga loves this new taxi driving work more than his old job.  This is Seyidaga's second loan.  He first borrowed $725 and is very grateful to the lenders for the credit.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy parts for his taxi.

loans.use: Purchase of parts for the car

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaituni N. lives in the Bwaise neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (two brothers).      

Zaituni has a business selling fruits and vegetables.  She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.   Zaituni sells her products at the market, by means of retail.   

Zaituni has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy boxes of fruits and vegetables like oranges,  cabbages, and mangoes.  She also generates additional income through selling bananas.

The main business challenges for  Zaituni include transport, the ever increasing prices of fruits, and the rainy season.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start growing fruits and vegetables herself.  

Zaituni lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and medication.

loans.use: To buy fruits & vegetables for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Succès Plus Group

texts.en:
Papy N. is the president of the Community Bank “Succès Plus”, which is composed of 22 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Papy runs a telephone booth and a games room for children in his area located west of Kinshasa. He began his business in 1997. His beginning capital was $10. With hard work and determination, his business has prospered. Papy is now well known and liked in this area. He has already received seven MFI HOPE DRC loans and fully repaid them. Since that time his business has prospered, and the loans he has received have helped him rent a well-located business place. He makes $90 profit each week. Papy intends to use the next loan to purchase more prepaid cards to meet customer demand and generate additional profits. His ambition is to open a cellular phones’ shop in his area. He is 33 years old and single. He also takes care of his younger brother.

loans.use: to buy more prepaid cards to meet customer demand and generate additional profits

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen A., 23 years old, is from the Obunga area in Kisumu city. She is a single mother of one child, William, 7 years old. Hellen has been running a fish business for the past two years. She fries fish and sells it to her clients who enjoy it very much. She is applying for her second loan to enable her to buy more fish to add to her stock in order to meet her clients' demands. The profits made from this business will be used to pay her son's school fees. Her desire is to be able to open up a hotel one day.

loans.use: to buy fish to add to her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase household equipment such as oil lamps, cups and spoons

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter M. is 32 years old.  He is from Kisumu city, married to Carolyne, and they have three children: Sharon, 14; Paul, 10; and Beatrice, 6.

Peter sells electrical goods like cables and bulbs and has been in this business for the past 10 years. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend who is also a client here. He will use the money to buy more electrical goods to add to his stock.

His desire is to expand his business and be able to open up an electrical shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy electrical goods for resale

loans.name: Merci Plus Group

texts.en:
Merci Plus is a Community Bank of 12 owners of small businesses, chaired by Junior. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva through the MFI HOPE DRCongo to grow their businesses.

Junior, 29, single, is a photographer and runs a telephone booth business. He became a micro-entrepreneur in 2007. He has already received six loans from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC and has fully repaid them. He intends to use the next loan to purchase camera accessories and prepaid cards to resell in order to reinforce his working capital. Currently he earns a profit of $45 per week.  Junior takes care of a child.

loans.use: To purchase camera accessories & prepaid cards to resell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther M. lives in the Masanafu neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has eight children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (mother-in-law).    

Esther has a business in poultry farming. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works 6 days out of every week.  Esther sells her chickens at Nakasero market by means of retail.    

Esther has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy poultry feed.  She also generates additional income through tailoring. 

The main business challenges for Esther include seasonality and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are expanding her poultry business and also to own a delivery van.    

Esther lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and transportation

loans.use: To buy poultry feed

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is a 61 year-old woman, married to Humphrey Mungai. Together they have seven children, ranging from ages 30 to 42.
