She has been in the business of dairy farming and she also rears pigs, for 40 years in the area of Kimuga, a rural area close to the capital city of Nairobi. She has sold milk to local dairies and produce to traders from the city.

Rahab was introduced to KADET by one of KADET's already existing clients. Using her loan, she intends to build a better and bigger pig sty in order to accommodate more pigs. 

In the future, she hopes to retire peacefully and to build a better house for herself and her family. She thanks the Kiva lenders who made the loan possible.

loans.use: To build a new pig sty

loans.name: Foi Plus Group

texts.en:
“Foi Plus” is a group of 9 owners of small businesses, chaired by Monique. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Monique has been selling second-hand clothing for years. Over the years, her business has prospered through determination and hard work, and she has been able to build a loyal customer base that has stabilized her business.  

After she joined one of Hope’s groups called “Foi Plus”, her business prospered thanks to the five different Hope loans she received, which she correctly repaid. Through her sales, Monique makes about $100 per week. 

She plans to use the coming loan from Hope to increase her inventory by purchasing one more bundle of second-hand clothing to resell at profit in order to increase her income.  Monique has points of sale within her community.   She dreams one day to open a large clothing business in Kinshasa. 

Monique is 45 years old, married, and a mother of nine children between the ages of 7 and 27. Six of them attend school. She is also taking charge of her younger sister.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothing for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Haydar

texts.ru:
Haydar A. 33 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Doch kotoroy 10 let ona uchitsya v shkole i sin kotoromu 5 let xodit v detskiy sadik. Haydar jivet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoyey semyoy.

Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye instrumenti i apparaturu dlya svoyey raboti. On ochen dobrosovestniy rabochiy on ochen lubit svoyu rabotu i s udovolstviyem vipolnyayet yeyo.
texts.en: Haydar A. is 33 years old.  He is married and has 2 children.  His 10-year-old daughter goes to school, and his 5-year-old son goes to kindergarten.  Haydar lives in the city of Baku with his family.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy tools and equipment necessary for his job.  He is a very conscientious worker, who loves and enjoys his work.

loans.use: Purchase of necessary tools and equipment

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto forma parte del banco comunal “Con Fuerza y Unión” perteneciente a la ciudad de Curicó. Él se dedica a la preparación de salsa de ají y condimentos, desde hace 30 años. Vende sus productos en una feria de la ciudad  todos los días de la semana junto a su hija.  
Con este préstamo comprará condimentos. Su meta es terminar de ampliar su casa. 
A Gilberto le han servido mucho los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza para seguir con su negocio. Además disfruta mucho el tiempo que pasa en las reuniones de grupo.
Curicó se ubica en la región del Maule, zona centro del país. El clima de Curicó es de tipo mediterráneo y es considerado como uno de los más agradables del país. Se caracteriza además por su cultura en torno al vino y sus alrededores de una belleza mágicamente natural.
texts.en:
Gilbert is part of the ‘Con Fuerza y Union’ Communal Bank located in the city of Curicó.

Gilbert has been making chili sauce and condiments for 30 years, which he and his daughter sell every day in a market in the city. Gilbert will use this loan to purchase condiments. His goal is to complete the extension on his house.  Gilbert’s business has benefited a lot from the previous loans he has taken out with Fondo Esperanza, and he also enjoys the time he spends in the group meetings.

Curicó is part of the region of Maule, located in the centre of Chile. It enjoys a mediterranean climate and is considered to be one of the most pleasant climates in the country. Curicó is known for its wine culture and the magical beauty of its natural surrounds.

loans.use: Condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. lives in the Kalerwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has four children; all of them are in school. She lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, feeding the family and school fees.

Rose has run a business selling yellow bananas for 10 years, working 6 days each week. She sells her products in the market at the retail level. Rose has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO in order to buy more bunches of both sweet and yellow bananas. The main business challenge for Rose is seasonality.  Her goals and hopes for her business are to expand it to earn more profit by going directly to farmers.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of yellow and sweet bananas

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a married man with three children; two of whom attend school while one is too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees. 

He operates a video show in a shop, neighbours being his potential customers. Andrew faces a major challenge of poor ventilation in his video room leading to complaints from customers while watching movies. He hopes to have a projector to use in watching international football to win more customers in the future.

Andrew decided to join Yehu because of its mission of empowering rural, economically marginalized entrepreneurs through enhanced accessibility to sustainable financial services. With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to pay for Dstv (digital satellite television) and renovate his video room.

loans.use: To pay for Dstv (digital satellite television) and renovate his video room.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice A. O., 30 years old, is from Kisumu city. She is married to Mathew Opiyo and they have two children aged 14 and 10 years. Eunice has a business selling second-hand clothes at Oile market in Kisumu. She has been doing this for the past two years and is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD. Eunice has a good credit history with us as she paid her first loan without much difficulty. She will use the money to buy five bales of clothes to add to her stock. Profits made from this business will be used for the family’s basic needs. Her desire is to expand her business and be able to open up a boutique in the future.

loans.use: Buy five  bales of clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María forma parte del banco comunal “Con Fuerza y Unión” perteneciente a la ciudad de Curicó. Ella se dedica a la pastelería, en su casa desde hace 7 años. Sus principales productos son pie de limón, queque de manzana y plátano, pan amasado y tortillas entre otros, los cuales vende por pedidos. Además María trabaja como asistente de educación en un colegio. 
Con este préstamo comprará ingredientes. Su sueño es dejar su trabajo dependiente para dedicarse 100% a la pastelería,  sin embargo este sueño lo está postergando hasta que sus hijos de 24 y 17 años terminen sus estudios superiores. El mayor estudia arquitectura en la universidad y el menor, cuando salga del colegio, a los 18, iniciará también sus estudios universitarios.
María agradece a Fondo Esperanza por confiar en ella al entregarle los préstamos y también  le motiva mucho la unidad de su grupo.
Curicó se ubica en la región del Maule, zona centro del país. El clima de Curicó es de tipo mediterráneo y es considerado como uno de los más agradables del país. Se caracteriza además por su cultura en torno al vino y sus alrededores de una belleza mágicamente natural
texts.en:
María is a part of the “Con Fuerza y Unión” [“With Strength and Unity”] communal bank in the city of Curicó. She has worked as a baker from her home for the past 7 years. Her main products are lemon pie, apple and banana cake, kneaded bread and Spanish tortillas, among others. She sells them by order. María also works as an educational assistant in a school.
She will buy ingredients with this loan. Her dream is to leave her job as an assistant to devote 100% of her time to baking, but she is holding off on this dream until her children, ages 24 and 17, finish college. The oldest studies architecture at the university. The youngest will also begin college once he finishes high school at 18.
María thanks Fondo Esperanza for trusting her by giving her loans. She is also very encouraged by the unity of her group. 
Curicó is located in the Maule region, the central area of the country. The climate in Curicó is Mediterranean-like and is considered one of the most pleasant in Chile. Curicó is also characterized by its wine culture and the magical natural beauty of the surrounding area.

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Akram

texts.en: Akram is 29 years old, married, and lives in Saida in the South of Lebanon. His main source of income is from his work as a painter, which he began in 2004. This is the first time that Akram has taken a loan with Al Majmoua and he is asking for $1000 USD to repair the vehicle he uses for work. He has gained a lot of experience in his trade and hopes to expand his business, becoming better known and generating more customers.

loans.use: Vehicle Repair

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria vive en la casa de sus padres cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, zona Brasil. Ella tiene un kiosco donde vende libros. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. Ella tiene una hija, vive con sus padres. 
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de cemento, ladrillos y arena. Esto le permitirá refaccionar su cocina y tener un mayor confort.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en: Maria and her daughter live with her parents in the Brasil area of El Alto. She has a kiosk where she sells books.  It is her main source of income.  She will use the loan to buy cement, bricks, and sand to refurbish the kitchen so that her family will have greater comfort.  This is her first loan with Impro.

loans.use: To buy cement, bricks, and sand to refurbish her kitchen.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda vive en casa de sus padres cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad Chahuira pampa Achacachi. Ella es productora lechera. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. Ella no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres sus padres también son productores lecheros. 
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de una vaca lechera. Esto le permitirá aumentar su producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro. Reúne las condiciones necesarias para ser sujeto de crédito.
texts.en:
Nilda lives in her parent's house, which is located in the community of Chahuira pampa Achacachi.  She works as a dairy farmer. This is her family's main source of income.  She doesn't have children, and her parents are also dairy farmers.

The loan will be used to purchase a dairy cow.  This will allow them to increase their milk production and earn more income.

This is Nilda's first loan with Impro.  She meets the requirements to be given a loan.

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow to improve milk production

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en: Maurine C. A.  lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of them in school. Maurine has a business selling yellow bananas and fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and works 7 days a week. She sells her products in a market, and has requested a loan of 400,000/- Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more produce. Her main business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goal is to expand her business. Maurine lives in a home that she rents with no access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses are rent, food, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy yellow bananas and boxes of cabbages

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia vive en casa de sus padres cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad Chijipina chico Achacachi. Ella es productora lechera. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. Ella tiene dos hijos, vive con sus padres, quienes  también son productores lecheros. 
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera. Esto le permitirá aumentar su producción de leche.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en: Antonia and her two children live with her parents in the community of Chijipina Chico, Achacachi.  She is a dairy farmer and this is her main source of income. Her parents are also dairy farmers. The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow.  This will allow her to increase milk production.  This is her first loan with Impro.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow in order to increase milk production.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
Emiliana vive en casa propia cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad Chahuira pampa de Achacachi. Ella es productora lechera y su esposo es profesor rural. Estas dos actividades son sus principales fuentes de ingreso para la manutención de la familia. Ella tiene tres hijos. 
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad para aumentar el volumen de producción de leche.

Es primer crédito con Impro, pero el análisis de su flujo de caja permite ver que Emiliana es capaz de repagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Emiliana lives in her own house located in the community of Chahuira Pampa in Achacachi.  She sells milk products and her husband is a rural teacher.  These two activities are the family's main sources of income.  She has three children.

The loan will be used for the purchase of a medium-quality dairy cow to increase the volume of milk production.

This is her first loan with Impro, but the analysis of her cash flow shows that Emiliana is capable of repaying the loan.

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow in order to increase the volume of milk production.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel, a 50 year-old father of four, has requested a loan of Kes. 70,000 to purchase products including pawpaws, pineapples, watermelons, potatoes, onions, carrots, bananas, oranges, pumpkins, green peas, and cabbages. He operates a grocery store in a good location in Nairobi with a steady flow of customers. He describes himself as hardworking, polite, and humble and plans to buy a piece of land in the future. He also hopes to open other outlets in other areas of the town in five years time.

loans.use: To purchase products including pawpaws, pineapples, watermelons, potatoes, onions, carrots, bananas, oranges, pumpkins, green peas, and cabbages.

loans.name: Saadoun

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old and a married man who has two children. Two of his siblings live with him.

He used to work in a service-based business but he decided to open his own coffee shop with pool tables in 2009. He rented a place and started his business. He has a good reputation in his local community.

He applied for a US$ 2400 loan to renovate his coffee shop so it will be more entertaining for his customers. And this way he will improve his and his family's standards of living.

loans.use: Renovating his coffee shop

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence O. is 55 years old and is from the Mamboleo area in the outskirts of Kisumu city. She is married to Fredrick Ngeso and they have seven children who are all above 18 years.

Florence has a cereals business and has been doing it for the past 10 years. She has created a huge clientele through the years and has high demands from them. She is in need of maize, beans, groundnuts and rice to add to her stock. The profits made will be used to pay school fees for her children.

Her desire is to venture into a chicken rearing business in the future

loans.use: Buy maize, beans, groundnuts and rice

loans.name: Nouha

texts.en:
Nouha is 39 years old and married with 2 children, living in Saida, in the south of Lebanon.

She is a seamstress & has a shop where she sells clothing.  Nouha began her business in 1996 and has had a previous loan through A. Majmoua, maintaining a strong repayment history.

Nouha found her previous loan very beneficiA. and is now asking for another loan of $1200 to increase the stock for her shop.

Nouha very much enjoys sewing and running a shop, and also finds the contact she has with customers very rewarding. Since beginning her business, Nouha has built up a large number of clientele.

loans.use: To buy supplies for sewing shop

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married 61-year-old woman who has been running a green grocery for 20 years. She sells most of the fruits which are in season like paw-paws, pineapples, oranges, mangoes, tomatoes and may more. Her monthly income from this business has been around Kshs 10,000. 

This is Mary's first loan with KADET, with which she intends to purchase cereals and a local cooking oven (called a "jiko" which utilizes charcoal) to make and sell githeri(a mixture of maize and beans fried with onions and tomatoes) as a secondary business. She also plans to be making other foods which include mashed potatoes and greens which she can also sell with the fruits on her fruits stand which serves as her grocery business.

In the future, she hopes to run a stable cereal store and one day open a hostel. She thanks the Kiva lenders who helped make her loan possible.

loans.use: To buy cereal stock and cooking oven for her secondary business of cooking foods.

loans.name: Widad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 48 years old and a married man who has six children.

In 2008 he decided to open his own shop for household gadgets so he rented a place and started his business. He is well known and has a good reputation in his area.

He is requesting a loan of US$ 2100 to renovate his shop, inside and out. This will help him to expand his business and grow bigger in the future, hoping to increase his income.

loans.use: Renovate his shop

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel has a mixed farm in Nyamira town in western Kenya that produces tea, maize, beans, cabbages and milk. He has been in the farming business for 15 years and sells all his products to the local market. He also earns income from his business of animal trading. His biggest challenge has been animal diseases which affect his production. 

Joel is 40 years old. He is married, with 5 school-aged children who all attend school.

He has requested this loan of 30,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will go towards the education of his children. 

In the future, he would like to expand his farming by increasing his acreage of tea plants and tree seedlings.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a 40-year-old father of three. He operates a curio business in a good and conducive environment in Nairobi.  He has been running this business since 2008. 

He is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase wood, paint and brushes for making curios. 

He is married and hopes to own a big curio shop and a successful business in the future. His living standard has improved since joining Faulu as a result of the financial support from the company. He also practices dairy farming to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase wood, paint and brushes

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a single woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She operates a retail business selling cereals such as maize, beans, and rice. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Caroline faces a major challenge of transportation and passersby. She hopes to open a wholesale business in the future.  

With the 30,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase sacks of maize, beans, and rice for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize, beans, and rice for resale

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel K. is 33 years old.  He is from the Ebwirani area in the outskirts of Kisumu city.  He is married to Loice and they have four chidren aged six years and three months old. 

Daniel has a charcoal business that he has been doing for the past six years. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend who is a client. He intends to use the loan to buy 10 sacks of charcoal to add to his stock. 

His dream is to build a charcoal shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Renovating her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Cristian Karolina

texts.es: Cristian Karolina tiene 31 años, tiene 2 hijos que están a su cargo. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues ha sido muy provechoso. Ella se dedica a su actividad económica es la venta de artesanía, inicia este negocio por su mama ya que ella era la que tenía el control de su negocio, mas tarde decide independizarse obtener su propio negocio. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, su negocio está ubicado en el parque central, en donde transitan muchos turistas. Este crédito es para la compra de hamacas, llaveros, camisetas, trajes típicos, bolsos entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Cristian Karolina is 31 years old and has two children in her care.  This is not the first time she has taken a loan. The financing has helped her business a great deal.  She is in the business of selling crafts.  Her mother started this business and had been managing it.  Later, Cristian decided to become independent and start her own business.  She is a very hard-working woman.  Many tourists walk through the central park where her business is located.  This loan will be used to buy hammocks, key chains, shirts, traditional costumes, and bags, among other items.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Najem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 41 years old. He is married and has five children. He graduated from the Faculty of Nursing and in 1995 he opened a place providing nursing services. He has an excellent reputation and he is well known in his community.

After benefiting from prior loans, now he is applying for a US$ 2600 loan to renovate the place and buy a small generator. He is aiming to grow bigger so he will be able to increase his family's quality of life.

loans.use: Renovating the place and buying a small generator

loans.name: Naeima

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is a 36-year-old woman. She is married and has four children. She decided to open her own business in 2006. Therefore she opened a clothing and household products shop. She is well known in her area and has a good reputation.

She applied for a US$ 1200 loan to renovate her shop and install a rolling shutter, aiming to grow bigger and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: Renovating her shop and installing a rolling shutter

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PUNTUALITO ”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mery ; ella tiene 39 años de edad ,conviviente  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agencia de turismo ,vendiendo paquetes turísticos , boletos turísticos .La socia trabaja desde las 08:00 am  hasta la 07:00pm de lunes a sábado  , la socia quiere ampliar su negocio  .
 La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su agencia de viajes ya que es el único sustento para su familia.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mery is a member of the community bank "Puntualito", which is located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.

Mery is 39 years old, married, and has two children.  She balances her daily activities with work at a travel agency, selling travel packages and tickets.  She works from 8:00am to 7:00pm from Monday to Saturday.  She would like to improve her business.  

She is asking for this loan in order to improve her travel agency because it is the only income her family has.

Mery is thankful to everyone who is helping her achieve her dream with this loan, and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Improve her travel agency business

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PUNTUALITO ”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Eusebia ; ella tiene 40 años de edad ,viuda  y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ropa , viajando cada fin de semana de Cusco a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado ,quedándose 2 a 3 dias  para luego retornar a Cusco al cuidado de sus hijos   . 

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio  ya que es el único sustento para su familia.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Eusebia belongs to the “Puntualito” community bank which is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of the same name.

Eusebia is 40 years old.  She is a widow and has 4 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business buying and selling clothes.  Every weekend she travels from Cusco to the city of Puerto Maldonado, staying there 2 or 3 days before returning to Cusco to look after her children.

She is requesting this loan to expand her business since it is the only means of support for her family.

She is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To expand her business as it is the only means of support for her family

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PUNTUALITO ”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladys; ella tiene 40 años de edad ,conviviente  y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de comida ,siendo su hijo mayor quien la apoya en este negocio, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00am hasta las 7:00pm  . 

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su restaurante  para comprar insumos para cocinar como arroz , aceite.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
Gladys is 40 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 4 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling food.  Her eldest son supports her in the business.  She works from 7.00am to 7.00pm.

She is requesting this loan to keep her restaurant in operation, buying cooking ingredients such as rice and oil.

She is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To keep her restaurant in operation, to buy cooking ingredients such as rice and oil

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a 32-year-old business lady who does dairy farming. She has been practicing dairy since 2006 with a good market for her products. 

She is requesting for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy a cow, a loan guaranteed by Jirani Mwema Shg. 

Faith is married and is a mother of two. She describes herself as polite and patient and also practices subsistence farming. She dreams of being a competitive and successful dairy farmer. Since she joined Faulu, her living standard has improved.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man with three children, two of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

He has operated a green grocery business, selling in a shop to his neighbours and passers-by. In addition, he sells charcoal and scratch telephone cards, contributing to his other sources of income. 

George faces a major challenge in the price inflation of his products. He hopes to open a cereal shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 he wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables for resale. He decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra vive en la zona de Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Es estudiante, y recibe la ayuda de su abuela para que pueda estudiar en la Universidad Católica de Bolivia.
Es soltera y no tiene hijos.
El crédito será destinado para el pago de  estudios superiores en la Universidad Católica de Bolivia y así poder al siguiente año trabajar y generar sus propios ingresos
Es la sexta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva. Su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Alejandra lives in the Obrajes area of the city of La Paz, Bolivia. She is a student and is getting help from her grandmother so that she can study at the Universidad Católica de Bolivia [Catholic University of Bolivia].

Alejandra is single and has no children. She is asking for a loan to pay for her college expenses, so that the next year she can work and generate her own income. 

This is the sixth loan that Alejandra has gotten through Impro, and her second loan to be financed through Kiva. Her loan history qualifies her as a top borrower, because she has been so good about repaying her loans on time.

loans.use: To pay for tuition and other college expenses at the Universidad Catolica Boliviana, in order to finish her studies.

loans.name: Desideriyo

texts.en:
Desideriyo is 49 years old. She is married and has three children who are between 12 and 28 years old. One of her children goes to school and the others have completed their studies. Her husband sells shoes. Desideriyo sells shoes and sorghum. She has spent three years in this business and she is requesting this loan to buy more sorghum and shoes to sell. 

Her business is very important to her as it allowed her to build her house.  With the future profits she will now renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy shoes and sorghum to sell

loans.name: Egidia

texts.en:
Egidia is 40 years old. She is married and has five children between the ages of 7 and 15. All her children go to school. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Egidia sells food stuffs such as beans and sorghum. From this loan she will buy more beans and sorghum to sell.  With the profit from this business she will buy goats for rearing. 

Egidia says that this business has helped in solving various issues concerning the family. In the future she would like to divert from this business and set up her own shop.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ledis Esther

texts.es: Ledis de 53 años, con dos hijos en las edades de 29 y 32, es una mujer que vive en Costa Hermosa, barrio ubicado en el municipio de Soledad, se dedica la elaboración de artesanías y a la venta de mercancía variada. Su negocio inició hace 10 años vendiendo  ropa y calzado y gradualmente cuando aprendió técnicas artesanales en la ciudad  de Bogotá, donde vive su hija,  le agregó al negocio artesanías; es así como desde hace un año se dedica a la fabricación de muñecas y figuras en material de foamy y también enseña esta técnica, en iglesias y a domicilio.   Este es su séptimo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los anteriores  se ha beneficiado ella y su familia, porque   sus utilidades después de la inversión se han incrementado y  le han servido para remodelar su vivienda; con su credikiva planea por una parte comprar láminas de foamy para fabricar muñecos navideños y con el resto comprará mercancía para vestir a sus clientes en las fiestas decembrinas. Su sueño es abrir un punto comercial en unión de su hermana, donde vendan artículos para decoración de fiestas, elaborados por sus propias manos y cumplir este sueño  es su máximo desafío.
texts.en:
Ledis is 53 years old and has two children aged 29 and 32.  She lives in the neighborhood of Costa Hermosa in the town of Soledad.  

She works making crafts and selling a variety of merchandise.  Her business started ten years ago selling clothing and shoes.  As Ledis learned crafting techniques in Bogotá, where her daughter lives, she began to sell more crafts.  For the last year, she has focused on creating dolls and figurines in a rubber foam material.  She also teaches craft classes at church and in homes.

This is her seventh loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  They have benefited her and her family because her income rose after her investment in her business, and they have been able to remodel their home.

With this loan, she plans to use part to purchase sheets of rubber foam to make Christmas dolls, and to use the rest to purchase clothing her customers can wear during the upcoming holiday season.

Her dream is to open a business with her sister where they will sell hand-made party decorations.  Achieving this dream is her ultimate challenge.

loans.use: Purchase sheets of rubber foam to make Christmas dolls and buy holiday clothing for her customers
